73 struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer
74 {
75  struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer *pNext; // singly linked list [for now]
76  // NOTE: a background process can trim this to a reasonable size
77 
78  // NOTE: for a simple row/col insert or paste, left=right, top=bottom
79  // for all other operations, the rctSel will apply accordingly
80  WB_RECT rctSelOld; // original select rectangle (as applicable)
81  WB_RECT rctSelNew; // new select rectangle after the operation
82 
83  int iOperation; // select=0, delete=1, insert/paste=2, replace=3
84  int iSelMode; // selection mode
85 
86  int nOld; // size of 'old' buffer (zero if none)
87  int nNew; // size of 'new' buffer (zero if none)
88 
89  char aData[2]; // actual data for operation
90 };

99 #define SEL_RECT_ALL(X) ((X)->rctSel.left < 0)
100 #define SEL_RECT_EMPTY(X) (!SEL_RECT_ALL(X) && ((X)->rctSel.left == (X)->rctSel.right && (X)->rctSel.bottom == (X)->rctSel.top))
101 #define NORMALIZE_SEL_RECT(X) {if((X).top > (X).bottom || ((X).top == (X).bottom && (X).left > (X).right)) \
102  { int i1 = (X).left; (X).left = (X).right; (X).right = i1; i1 = (X).top; (X).top = (X).bottom; (X).bottom = i1; }}

253 static __inline__ const char * __internal_get_line_ending_text(enum _LineFeed_ iIndex)
254 {
255  static const char * const szLineEndings[LineFeed_ENTRYCOUNT] =
256  {
257 #ifdef WIN32
258  "\r\n"
259 #else // POSIX
260  "\n",
261 #endif // OS-dependent line endings
262  "\n","\r","\r\n","\n\r"
263  };
264 
265  if((int)iIndex < 0 || (int)iIndex >= LineFeed_ENTRYCOUNT)
266  {
267  return NULL; // single-line or invalid
268  }
269  return szLineEndings[iIndex];
270 }

280 // TODO: an API function for single-line text

282 #define DEFAULT_TEXT_BUFFER_LINES 16384
283 
284 TEXT_BUFFER * WBAllocTextBuffer(const char *pBuf, unsigned int cbBufSize)
285 {
286 TEXT_BUFFER *pRval;
287 int nLines = 0;
288 int cbLen;
289 
290  if(pBuf && (cbBufSize || *pBuf))
291  {
292  nLines = WBStringLineCount(pBuf, cbBufSize);
293 
294 // WBDebugPrint("TEMPORARY: WBAllocTextBuffer %d lines\n", nLines);
295  }
296 
297  if(nLines < DEFAULT_TEXT_BUFFER_LINES)
298  {
299  nLines = DEFAULT_TEXT_BUFFER_LINES;
300  }
301 
302  cbLen = sizeof(*pRval) + nLines * sizeof(pRval->aLines[0]);
303  pRval = WBAlloc(cbLen);
304 
305  if(!pRval)
306  {
307  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR - %s - not enough memory (%ld)\n", __FUNCTION__,
308  (unsigned long)(sizeof(*pRval) + nLines * sizeof(pRval->aLines[0])));
309  return NULL;
310  }
311 
312  memset(pRval, 0, cbLen); // zero out entire structure (always)
313 
314  pRval->nArraySize = nLines; // pre-assigned values
315 // pRval->nEntries = 0; already zero, comment left for reference
316 
317  if(pBuf && (cbBufSize || *pBuf))
318  {
319  int nL = 0;
320  const char *p1;
321 
322  if(!cbBufSize)
323  {
324  cbBufSize = strlen(pBuf);
325  }
326 
327  do
328  {
329  int cbLen;
330  char *p2, *p3;
331 
332  cbLen = cbBufSize; // size before I begin
333  p1 = WBStringNextLine(pBuf, &cbBufSize);
334 
335  if(p1) // another line remains
336  {
337  cbLen = p1 - pBuf; // re-calc length based on new pointer
338  }
339 
340  p2 = WBAlloc(cbLen + 2);
341 
342  if(!p2)
343  {
344  WBFreeTextBuffer(pRval);
345  pRval = NULL;
346  break;
347  }
348 
349  if(cbLen) // it's possible it may be zero
350  {
351  memcpy(p2, pBuf, cbLen); // copy the data
352  }
353 
354  p3 = p2 + cbLen; // the end of the string
355  *p3 = 0; // always zero-byte terminate it first
356 
357  while(p3 > p2 && (*(p3 - 1) <= ' ' || *(p3 - 1) == HARD_TAB_CHAR)) // trim ALL trailing white space including CR, LF, tab, space, FF, etc.
358  {
359  // TODO: handle <FF> or <VT> differently?
360  // TODO: leave white space to mark 'extent' of line? naaw, probably not
361 
362  *(--p3) = 0; // for now just trim it all (p3 always points past end of string)
363  }
364 
365  pRval->aLines[nL++] = p2;
366 
367 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s - %4d: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, nL, p2);
368 
369  pBuf = p1;
370 
371  } while(pBuf && cbBufSize && nL < nLines);
372 
373  pRval->nEntries = nL; // NOTE: on error, this will be needed for cleanup
374 
375 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s - %ld lines\n", __FUNCTION__, pRval->nEntries);
376 
377  WBTextBufferRefreshCache(pRval);
378  }
379 
380 // if(pRval)
381 // {
382 // int nL;
383 //
384 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("\nTEMPORARY - %s - %ld lines\n", __FUNCTION__, pRval->nEntries);
385 //
386 // for(nL=0; nL < pRval->nEntries; nL++)
387 // {
388 // WB_ERROR_PRINT(" \"%s\"\n", pRval->aLines[nL]);
389 // }
390 //
391 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("END TEMPORARY - %s\n\n", __FUNCTION__);
392 // }
393 
394 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s returns %p\n", __FUNCTION__, pRval);
395 
396  return pRval;
397 }

399 int WBCheckReAllocTextBuffer(TEXT_BUFFER **ppBuf, int nLinesToAdd)
400 {
401 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
402 int nNew;
403 
404  if(!ppBuf || !*ppBuf)
405  {
406  return -1; // error
407  }
408 
409  // TODO: parameter validation
410 
411  pBuf = *ppBuf;
412 
413  nNew = pBuf->nEntries + nLinesToAdd;
414 
415  if(nNew > pBuf->nArraySize)
416  {
417  nNew += DEFAULT_TEXT_BUFFER_LINES;
418  nNew -= (nNew % (DEFAULT_TEXT_BUFFER_LINES / 2));
419 
420  pBuf = WBReAlloc(pBuf, sizeof(*pBuf) + nNew * sizeof(pBuf->aLines[0]));
421 
422  if(!pBuf)
423  {
424  return -1; // error
425  }
426 
427  pBuf->nArraySize = nNew;
428  *ppBuf = pBuf; // potentially new pointer - probably is, though
429  }
430 
431  return 0; // no problems
432 }
433 
434 void WBFreeTextBuffer(TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf)
435 {
436 int i1;
437 
438  if(!pBuf)
439  {
440  return;
441  }
442 
443  // TODO: parameter validation
444 
445  for(i1=0; i1 < pBuf->nEntries && i1 < pBuf->nArraySize; i1++)
446  {
447  if(pBuf->aLines[i1])
448  {
449  WBFree(pBuf->aLines[i1]);
450  pBuf->aLines[i1] = NULL; // by convention
451  }
452  }
453 
454  WBFree(pBuf);
455 }
456 
457 void WBTextBufferLineChange(TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf, unsigned long nLine, int nNewLen)
458 {
459 int i1, i2;
460 unsigned int nNewMax = 0, nNewMinMax = UINT_MAX;
461 
462 
463  if(pBuf->nEntries <= 1) // zero or one lines?
464  {
465  WBTextBufferRefreshCache(pBuf); // always do it THIS way
466  return;
467  }
468 
469  if(nLine > pBuf->nEntries) // line number isn't sane?
470  {
471  return; // sanity check failed (do nothing)
472  }
473 
474  // update the line info in my cache. If this line appears, remove it (always).
475  // If I'm deleting the line, subtract one from every line higher than this one.
476 
477  for(i1=0; i1 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE && pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1]; i1++)
478  {
479  if(pBuf->aLineCache[i1] == nLine)
480  {
481  // move everything up, remove the last entry, decrement i1
482  for(i2=i1 + 1; i2 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE && pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2]; i2++)
483  {
484  pBuf->aLineCache[i2] = pBuf->aLineCache[i2 + 1];
485  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2] = pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2 + 1];
486 
487  // now by convention mark that last entry as if it's unused
488  pBuf->aLineCache[i2 + 1] = 0;
489  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2 + 1] = 0; // an 'end' marker (if the loop exits, it becomes the new 'end')
490  }
491 
492  i1--; // so I do the 'next' one as I should
493  }
494  else
495  {
496  if(pBuf->aLineCache[i1] > nLine)
497  {
498  if(nNewLen < 0) // a line deletion
499  {
500  pBuf->aLineCache[i1] --; // line was removed, so new line count must match
501  }
502  }
503 
504  if(nNewMax < pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1])
505  {
506  nNewMax = pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1]; // done this way as sanity check
507  }
508 
509  if(nNewMinMax > pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1])
510  {
511  nNewMinMax = pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1]; // done this way as sanity check
512  }
513  }
514  }
515 
516  // if the cache is NOW empty, re-evaluate it.
517  if(!pBuf->aLineCacheLen[0]) // empty
518  {
519  WBTextBufferRefreshCache(pBuf);
520  return;
521  }
522 
523  // I've re-evaluated the max and min-max from the cache, so use that info
524 
525  pBuf->nMaxCol = nNewMax;
526 
527  if(nNewMinMax <= nNewMax) // NOTE: if cache is empty, nNewMinMax will be UINT_MAX
528  {
529  pBuf->nMinMaxCol = nNewMinMax; // sanity checked value
530  }
531  else
532  {
533  pBuf->nMinMaxCol = nNewMax; // don't put insane values in there (just in case)
534  // TODO: consider refactoring this code out once the algorithm is proved to work
535  }
536 
537  if(nNewLen < 0) // a line deletion
538  {
539  if(!nNewMax) // in case my cache has dwindled to nothing
540  {
541  WBTextBufferRefreshCache(pBuf); // time to re-evaluate
542  }
543 
544  return; // I'm done for delete. The rest is for updates
545  }
546 
547  // see if the length exceeds any of the maximums, and do an 'insertion sort'
548  // into my cache array if it does. Otherwise I can just leave.
549 
550  if(nNewLen >= pBuf->nMaxCol) // bigger than maximum (or equal to it)
551  {
552  i2 = 0; // my insert point
553 
554  pBuf->nMaxCol = nNewLen; // new 'max'
555  if(nNewLen < nNewMinMax) // sanity test for empty cache
556  {
557  pBuf->nMinMaxCol = nNewLen; // may happen, if new cache is totally empty
558  }
559  }
560  else if(nNewLen >= pBuf->nMinMaxCol) // between min max and max
561  {
562  // find the place to insert this line into the cache
563  i2 = 0; // NOTE: platform-independent loop structure, probably not necessary, but...
564  while(i2 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE && pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2])
565  {
566  if(pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2] < nNewLen) // the insert point
567  {
568  break;
569  }
570 
571  i2++; // don't forget this or infinite loop will result, heh
572  }
573  }
574  else
575  {
576  return; // I'm done - no need to re-insert this line into the cache (yet)
577  // NOTE: re-inserting the line into the cache would require re-doing the
578  // cache information from scratch. this is an optimization, so I'll
579  // avoid THAT operation until it's truly necessary.
580  }
581 
582  if(i2 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE) // sanity check, might happen
583  {
584  // insert at 'i2'
585  for(i1=TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE - 1; i1 > i2; i1--)
586  {
587  pBuf->aLineCache[i1] = pBuf->aLineCache[i1 - 1];
588  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1] = pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1 - 1];
589  }
590 
591  pBuf->aLineCache[i2] = nLine;
592  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2] = nNewLen;
593  }
594 
595  // everything should be ok now, unless I b0rked something
596 }
597 
598 void WBTextBufferRefreshCache(TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf)
599 {
600 int iLine, i1, i2, i3;
601 char *p1;
602 
603  if(!pBuf)
604  {
605  return;
606  }
607 
608  // zero out the cache arrays
609  memset(pBuf->aLineCache, 0, sizeof(pBuf->aLineCache));
610  memset(pBuf->aLineCacheLen, 0, sizeof(pBuf->aLineCacheLen));
611 
612  pBuf->nMaxCol = pBuf->nMinMaxCol = 0; // initialize to zero
613 
614  if(!pBuf->nEntries)
615  {
616  return;
617  }
618  else if(pBuf->nEntries == 1)
619  {
620  if(pBuf->aLines[0])
621  {
622  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[0] = // refactored, do this assignment here instead
623  pBuf->nMaxCol = pBuf->nMinMaxCol = WBGetMBLength(pBuf->aLines[0]); // assign length to 'max' and 'minmax'
624 // if(pBuf->nMaxCol) 'refactored out' (left to document process, remove later)
625 // {
626 // pBuf->aLineCache[0] = 0; this value already assigned by 'memset'
627 // pBuf->aLineCacheLen[0] = pBuf->nMaxCol; refactored code does this
628 // }
629  }
630 
631  return;
632  }
633 
634  // the big loop
635 
636  for(iLine=0; iLine < pBuf->nEntries; iLine++)
637  {
638  // do not consider blank lines or lines with zero length
639  p1 = pBuf->aLines[iLine];
640 
641  if(!p1)
642  {
643  continue;
644  }
645 
646  i1 = WBGetMBLength(p1);
647 
648  if(!i1)
649  {
650  continue;
651  }
652 
653  if(i1 > pBuf->nMinMaxCol) // assume data is consistent
654  {
655  // perform an insertion sort into 'aLineCache'
656 
657  // step 1: find the insertion point
658 
659  i2 = 0; // NOTE: platform-independent loop structure, probably not necessary, but...
660  while(i2 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE && pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2])
661  {
662  if(pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2] < i1) // the insert point
663  {
664  break;
665  }
666 
667  i2++; // don't forget this or infinite loop will result, heh
668  }
669 
670  if(i2 >= TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE) // logic fail, clean it up
671  {
672  pBuf->nMaxCol = pBuf->aLineCacheLen[0]; // forced re-evaluation
673  pBuf->nMinMaxCol = pBuf->aLineCacheLen[TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE - 1];
674  }
675  else if(i2 == TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE - 1)
676  {
677  // special case, insert at the end
678  pBuf->aLineCache[i2] = iLine;
679  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2] = i1;
680 
681  pBuf->nMinMaxCol = i1; // the new 'min max'
682  }
683  else
684  {
685  // if this is the first line in the cache, update 'nMaxCol'
686  if(!i2) // NOTE: this test is done here 'cause of likely register optimization
687  {
688  pBuf->nMaxCol = i1;
689  }
690 
691  i3 = i2 + 1;
692  while(i3 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE && pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i3])
693  {
694  i3++; // finding the end
695  }
696 
697  // move everything down using 'memmove'
698 
699  memmove(&(pBuf->aLineCache[i2 + 1]), &(pBuf->aLineCache[i2]),
700  (i3 - i2 - 1) * sizeof(pBuf->aLineCache[0]));
701  memmove(&(pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2 + 1]), &(pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2]),
702  (i3 - i2 - 1) * sizeof(pBuf->aLineCacheLen[0]));
703 
704  // use the final line's index and re-assign the 'max' and 'min max'
705  pBuf->nMinMaxCol = pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i3 - 1];
706 
707  // make sure the last element(s) have a zero length (TODO: optimize?)
708  while(i3 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE)
709  {
710  pBuf->aLineCache[i3] = 0; // do this to, just because
711  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i3++] = 0;
712  }
713 
714  // and finally, insert this line's info at position 'i2'
715 
716  pBuf->aLineCache[i2] = iLine;
717  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2] = i1;
718  }
719  }
720  }
721 }

759 int WBTextObjectCalculateLineHeight(int iAscent, int iDescent) // consistently calculate line height from font ascent/descent
760 {
761 int iFontHeight;
762 
763  iFontHeight = iAscent + iDescent;
764 
765  // adjust font height to include line spacing (I'll use this to position the lines)
766  if(iDescent > MIN_LINE_SPACING / 2)
767  {
768  iFontHeight += iDescent / 2; // line spacing is 1/2 of descent, or MIN_LINE_SPACING
769  }
770  else
771  {
772  iFontHeight += MIN_LINE_SPACING;
773  }
774 
775  return iFontHeight;
776 }

805 static void __internal_free_undo_redo_buffer(void *pBuffer)
806 {
807  if(pBuffer)
808  {
809  // TODO: validate that it's an undo/redo buffer
810 
811  struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer *pU = (struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer *)pBuffer;
812 
813  do
814  {
815  struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer *pUsa = pU;
816 
817  pU = pU->pNext;
818  WBFree(pUsa); // for now just do this
819 
820  } while(pU);
821  }
822 }

824 #define UNDO_LIMIT 256
825 
826 // NULL 'prctStartSel' or 'prctEndSel' implies 'NONE' selected, i.e. {0,0,0,0}
827 static void __internal_add_undo(struct _text_object_ *pThis, int iOperation, int iSelMode,
828  int iStartRow, int iStartCol, const WB_RECT *prctStartSel,
829  const char *pStartText, int cbStartText,
830  int iEndRow, int iEndCol, const WB_RECT *prctEndSel,
831  const char *pEndText, int cbEndText)
832 {
833 int cbLen, cbLen2, i1;
834 struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer *pUndo, *pTU, *pTU2;
835 
836 
837  if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
838  {
839  return;
840  }
841 
842  pThis->iBlinkState = 0; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
843 
844  cbLen = cbLen2 = 0;
845 
846  if(pStartText)
847  {
848  if(cbStartText < 0)
849  {
850  cbStartText = strlen(pStartText); // TODO: WBGetMBLength ?
851  }
852 
853  if(cbStartText > 0)
854  {
855  cbLen += cbStartText;
856  }
857  }
858 
859  if(pEndText)
860  {
861  if(cbEndText < 0)
862  {
863  cbEndText = strlen(pEndText); // TODO: WBGetMBLength?
864  }
865 
866  if(cbEndText > 0)
867  {
868  cbLen2 += cbEndText;
869  }
870  }
871 
872  pUndo = (struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer *)WBAlloc(cbLen + cbLen2 + 4 + sizeof(*pUndo));
873  if(!pUndo)
874  {
875  // TODO: walk the 'undo' chain and start removing stuff, and retry the alloc
876 
877  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR - %s - unable to create undo buffer, errno=%d\n", __FUNCTION__, errno);
878  return;
879  }
880 
881  pUndo->iOperation = iOperation;
882  pUndo->iSelMode = iSelMode;
883 
884  if(prctStartSel)
885  {
886  memcpy(&(pUndo->rctSelOld), prctStartSel, sizeof(WB_RECT));
887  }
888  else
889  {
890  memset(&(pUndo->rctSelOld), 0, sizeof(WB_RECT));
891  }
892 
893  if(prctEndSel)
894  {
895  memcpy(&(pUndo->rctSelNew), prctEndSel, sizeof(WB_RECT));
896  }
897  else
898  {
899  memset(&(pUndo->rctSelNew), 0, sizeof(WB_RECT));
900  }
901 
902  // this code should work on multi-byte characters as well...
903 
904  pUndo->nOld = cbLen;
905  if(cbLen)
906  {
907  memcpy(pUndo->aData, pStartText, cbLen);
908  pUndo->aData[cbLen++] = 0; // just because
909  }
910 
911  pUndo->nOld = cbLen;
912 
913  if(cbLen2)
914  {
915  memcpy(pUndo->aData + cbLen, pEndText, cbLen2);
916  pUndo->aData[cbLen + cbLen2++] = 0; // just because
917  }
918 
919  pUndo->nNew = cbLen2;
920 
921  // insert undo buffer into the 'chain'
922 
923  pTU = pUndo->pNext = (struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer *)(pThis->pUndo);
924  pThis->pUndo = pUndo;
925 
926  // NOW walk the chain and remove things past a certain point. For now, UNDO_LIMIT
927  // NOTE: this is a compromise - the alternative is a double-link list and an 'end' pointer
928  // along with a running count of items. If the number of undo/redo items becomes
929  // VERY large, that might be a better alternative. So for now I use a single-link list.
930 
931  if(pTU)
932  {
933  for(i1=1; i1 < UNDO_LIMIT && pTU->pNext; pTU = pTU->pNext, i1++) { }
934  // on a modern CPU, this shouldn't take more than a few microseconds
935 
936  if(pTU->pNext) // will only be true if I have too many entries
937  {
938  // free and unhook the chain
939  pTU2 = pTU->pNext;
940  pTU->pNext = NULL; // generally safer THIS way
941 
942  __internal_free_undo_redo_buffer(pTU2); // NOW free what was once chained from here
943  }
944  }
945 
946  // whenever I add an 'undo' HERE, I screw up the 'redo' so blast it away if it exists
947  if(pThis->pRedo)
948  {
949  pTU = pThis->pRedo;
950  pThis->pRedo = NULL;
951 
952  __internal_free_undo_redo_buffer(pTU);
953  }
954 }

1126 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
1127 // __internal_get_selected_text - arbitrary text retrieval (internal only)
1128 // returns WBAlloc'd string pointer
1129 //
1130 // iRow is the starting row position
1131 // iCol is the starting column position
1132 // iEndRow is the ending row position. In modes OTHER than 'box mode', this may equal 'iCol'
1133 // iEndCol is the ending column position. In modes OTHER than 'box mode' this may be LESS than 'iCol'
1134 static char * __internal_get_selected_text(const struct _text_object_ *pThis, int iRow, int iCol, int iEndRow, int iEndCol)
1135 {
1136 int i1, i2, i3, cb1, cbLF=0;
1137 char *p1, *pRval = NULL;
1138 const char *szLineFeed = NULL;
1139 TEXT_BUFFER *pTB;
1140 int iIsBoxMode, iIsLineMode;
1141 
1142 
1143  WBDebugPrint("TEMPORARY: __internal_get_selected_text(%d,%d,%d,%d)\n", iRow, iCol, iEndRow, iEndCol);
1144 
1145  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
1146  {
1147  if(!pThis->pText)
1148  {
1149  return WBCopyString(""); // return a blank string
1150  }
1151 
1152  if(iRow < 0)
1153  {
1154  iRow = 0;
1155  }
1156  if(iCol < 0)
1157  {
1158  iCol = 0;
1159  }
1160  if(iEndRow < 0)
1161  {
1162  iEndRow = INT_MAX;
1163  }
1164  if(iEndCol < 0)
1165  {
1166  iEndCol = INT_MAX;
1167  }
1168 
1169  if(iRow == iEndRow)
1170  {
1171  iIsBoxMode = iIsLineMode = 0;
1172  }
1173  else
1174  {
1175  if(pThis->iSelMode == SelectMode_BOX)
1176  {
1177  iIsBoxMode = 1;
1178  iIsLineMode = 0;
1179  }
1180  else if(pThis->iSelMode == SelectMode_LINE)
1181  {
1182  iIsBoxMode = 0;
1183  iIsLineMode = 1;
1184  }
1185  else // char and default
1186  {
1187  iIsBoxMode = 0;
1188  iIsLineMode = 0;
1189  }
1190  }
1191 
1192  if(iRow > iEndRow // row exceeds ending row
1193  || (iRow == iEndRow && iCol >= iEndCol) // single row with no 'width'
1194  /* || (box mode && iCol >= iEndCol) */) // box mode requires iCol < iEndCol
1195  {
1196  return WBCopyString(""); // return a blank string
1197  }
1198 
1199  pTB = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
1200 
1201  // NOTE: when iRow == iEndRow, both box mode and line mode revert to 'stream mode'
1202  // and the 'iIsBoxMode' and 'iIsStreamMode' flags will both be zero
1203 
1204  if(iIsBoxMode)
1205  {
1206  cb1 = (iEndRow - iRow + 1) * (2 + iEndCol - iCol);
1207  }
1208  else
1209  {
1210  // FOR NOW just go through the TEXT_BUFFER array, determine the length (later cache it)
1211 
1212  for(i1=iRow, cb1=4; i1 < pTB->nEntries && i1 <= iEndRow; i1++)
1213  {
1214  i2 = strlen(pTB->aLines[i1]); // use 'strlen' here, as I want the REAL length
1215 
1216  // last line in 'normal' select mode limits width - 'iEndCol' may be 0
1217  if(i1 == iEndRow // i.e. "the last line" in the selected area
1218  && !iIsLineMode) // NOT 'line mode' (will be always false for single-row selects)
1219  {
1220  if(i2 > iEndCol) // trim the indicated length of the line accordingly
1221  {
1222  i2 = WBGetMBCharPtr(pTB->aLines[i1], iEndCol, NULL) - pTB->aLines[i1];
1223  }
1224  }
1225 
1226  cb1 += i2 + 2; // do this regardless (it's only to count up max string length)
1227  }
1228  }
1229 
1230  // now build the string using the specified line ending and selection mode
1231 
1232  szLineFeed = __internal_get_line_ending_text(pThis->iLineFeed);
1233 
1234  if(!szLineFeed) // single-line
1235  {
1236  if(pTB->nEntries > 1)
1237  {
1238  szLineFeed = __internal_get_line_ending_text(LineFeed_DEFAULT); // fallback with multi-line data
1239  }
1240  }
1241 
1242  if(szLineFeed)
1243  {
1244  cbLF = strlen(szLineFeed);
1245  }
1246 
1247  pRval = WBAlloc(cb1); // allocate the buffer
1248 
1249  if(pRval)
1250  {
1251  p1 = pRval;
1252  for(i1=iRow, p1 = pRval; i1 < pTB->nEntries && i1 <= iEndRow; i1++)
1253  {
1254  char *pTheLine = pTB->aLines[i1];
1255 
1256  // TODO: validate pRval + cb1 > p1 + length of "the stuff that follows"
1257  i2 = i3 = strlen(pTheLine); // the TRUE 'binary' length
1258 
1259  // TODO: for box mode limit the width on all lines and pad with white space as needed
1260 
1261  // TODO: handle hard tab translation? For now "leave it". Later, I should use a character
1262  // that prints as 'white space' but translates as a 'hard tab'.
1263  // Example might be 0xA0, i.e. a ' ' + 80H, filling up spaces to the tab point. Delete
1264  // and insert would have to compensate for this. This function ALSO would have to compensate,
1265  // translating tabs to spaces for box mode, and to hard tabs for everything else when 'select all'
1266  // is not in effect and tabs are preserved.
1267  // For 'select all', hard tabs (when preserved) would be translated into a minimum number of
1268  // tab characters; otherwise they would translate into spaces. Also a hard tab should be displayed
1269  // differently (when preserved), such as a greyed |--> or similar.
1270  // When 'do not preserve tabs' is set, inserted tabs should automatically become spaces. ONLY when
1271  // the tabs are being preserved should the translation take place.
1272  //
1273  // CASE FOR USING 'A0' FOR HARD TAB
1274  // a) UTF8 does not use it as a marker for multi-byte character data - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF-8
1275  // b) it's basically a ' ' with the high bit set
1276  // c) it's not used for anything significant in 8-bit ASCII other than "non-breaking space" (i.e. &nbsp;)
1277  // d) if it's imported, it will translate to actual spaces
1278  // e) if it's exported by accident, it probably won't matter (other than formatting)
1279  // f) a definition NOW exists - see HARD_TAB_CHAR (text_object.h)
1280 
1281  // last line in 'normal' select mode limits width - 'iEndCol' may be 0
1282  if(i1 == iEndRow // i.e. "the last line" in the selected area
1283  || iIsBoxMode) // box mode limits length differently on all lines
1284  {
1285  if(iIsBoxMode)
1286  {
1287  if(i2 >= iEndCol)
1288  {
1289  i2 = WBGetMBCharPtr(pTheLine, iEndCol, NULL) - WBGetMBCharPtr(pTheLine, iCol, NULL);
1290  }
1291  else if(iCol > 0)
1292  {
1293  i2 -= WBGetMBCharPtr(pTheLine, iCol, NULL) - pTheLine;
1294  }
1295  }
1296  else if(!iIsLineMode)
1297  {
1298  if(i2 >= iEndCol)
1299  {
1300  i2 = WBGetMBCharPtr(pTheLine, iEndCol, NULL) - pTheLine;
1301  }
1302  }
1303  else if(iEndCol == 0)
1304  {
1305  i2 = 0; // typically 'last row'
1306  }
1307  }
1308 
1309  // check for stream mode on the first line, and start with 'iCol'
1310  if(!iIsBoxMode && !iIsLineMode && i1 == iRow) // on first line, start at 'iCol'
1311  {
1312  i2 -= WBGetMBCharPtr(pTheLine, iCol, NULL) - pTheLine; // subtract starting column offset for total length
1313  }
1314 
1315  if(i2 > 0) // might be < 0 depending
1316  {
1317  if(iIsLineMode || i1 > iCol) // multi-line select NOT on first line, or line mode
1318  {
1319  memcpy(p1, pTheLine, i2);
1320  }
1321  else
1322  {
1323  memcpy(p1, WBGetMBCharPtr(pTheLine, iCol, NULL), i2);
1324  }
1325  p1 += i2;
1326  }
1327  else
1328  {
1329  i2 = 0; // for box mode, mostly
1330  }
1331 
1332  if(iIsBoxMode) // iRow < iEndRow also
1333  {
1334  // for box mode, pad any 'remaining' length with space
1335  i2 = iEndCol - iCol // the ending width we're SUPPOSED to have
1336  - WBGetMBLength(WBGetMBCharPtr(pTheLine, iCol, NULL)); // the actual length in 'columns' starting at 'iCol'
1337 
1338  // I need THAT MANY white spaces for box mode
1339  if(i2 > 0)
1340  {
1341  memset(p1, ' ', i2);
1342  p1 += i2; // now the width should be exactly 'iEndCol - iCol'
1343  }
1344  }
1345 
1346  // don't add final line feed in 'stream' mode or in 'line' mode if it ends on column 0
1347 
1348  if(iIsBoxMode || // box mode ALWAYS
1349  (iIsLineMode && iEndCol > 0) || // I'm in line mode and NOT ending on column 0 on the last line
1350  i1 < iEndRow) // not the last line
1351  {
1352  if(szLineFeed)
1353  {
1354  memcpy(p1, szLineFeed, cbLF);
1355  p1 += cbLF;
1356  }
1357  }
1358  }
1359 
1360  *p1 = 0;
1361  }
1362  }
1363 
1364  return pRval;
1365 }

1367 static void __internal_invalidate_cursor(const struct _text_object_ *pThis, int bPaintFlag)
1368 {
1369 WB_RECT rctCursor;
1370 
1371  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis) && pThis->wIDOwner != None)
1372  {
1373  rctCursor.left = pThis->iCursorX - 1;
1374  rctCursor.top = pThis->iCursorY - 1;
1375  rctCursor.bottom = rctCursor.top + pThis->iCursorHeight + 2;
1376 
1377  if(pThis->iInsMode == InsertMode_OVERWRITE)
1378  {
1379  rctCursor.right = rctCursor.left + pThis->iFontWidth;
1380  }
1381  else
1382  {
1383  rctCursor.right = rctCursor.left + 3;
1384  }
1385 
1386  WBInvalidateRect(pThis->wIDOwner, &rctCursor, bPaintFlag);
1387  }
1388 }

1390 static void __internal_invalidate_rect(const struct _text_object_ *pThis, WB_RECT *pRect, int bPaintFlag)
1391 {
1392 WB_RECT rctInvalid;
1393 
1394  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis) && pThis->wIDOwner != None)
1395  {

1399

1422  {

1424  }

1426  {

1428  }
1429  if(pThis->rctWinView.top - MIN_BORDER_SPACING > rctInvalid.top)
1430  {
1431  rctInvalid.top = pThis->rctWinView.top - MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
1432  }
1433  if(pThis->rctWinView.bottom + MIN_BORDER_SPACING < rctInvalid.bottom)
1434  {
1435  rctInvalid.bottom = pThis->rctWinView.bottom + MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
1436  }
1437 
1438  WBInvalidateRect(pThis->wIDOwner, &rctInvalid, bPaintFlag);
1439 
1440 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - invalidate %d,%d,%d,%d for %u (%08xH)\n",
1441 // __FUNCTION__,
1442 // rctInvalid.left, rctInvalid.top, rctInvalid.right, rctInvalid.bottom,
1443 // (int)pThis->wIDOwner, (int)pThis->wIDOwner);
1444 
1445  }
1446 // else
1447 // {
1448 // if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
1449 // {
1450 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - invalid text object\n", __FUNCTION__);
1451 // }
1452 // else

1455 // }
1456 // }

1459 // NOTE: iStartRow and iStartCol may be 0 but not negative
1460 // iEndRow and iEndCol can be negative to indicate "all"
1461 static void __internal_calc_rect(const struct _text_object_ *pThis, WB_RECT *pRect, int iStartRow, int iStartCol, int iEndRow, int iEndCol)
1462 {
1463 int iFontHeight;
1464 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
1465 
1466  if(!pRect || !WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
1467  {
1468  if(pRect)
1469  {
1470  memset(pRect, 0, sizeof(*pRect));
1471  }
1472 
1473  return;
1474  }
1475 
1476  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText); // might be NULL, must check before use
1477 
1478  if(iEndRow < 0)
1479  {
1480  if(pBuf && pThis->iLineFeed != LineFeed_NONE)
1481  {
1482  iEndRow = pBuf->nEntries;
1483  }
1484  else
1485  {
1486  iEndRow = 0;
1487  }
1488  }
1489 
1490  // examine the viewpoint rect, font height, and other info
1491 
1492  iFontHeight = pThis->iAsc + pThis->iDesc;
1493 
1494  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE) // i.e. SINGLE LINE (ignore row)
1495  {
1496  // top of line will always be centered
1497 
1498  pRect->top = pThis->rctWinView.top
1499  + (pThis->rctWinView.bottom - pThis->rctWinView.top
1500  - pThis->iAsc - pThis->iDesc)
1501  / 2;
1502 
1503  pRect->bottom = pRect->top + iFontHeight; // always
1504 
1505  pRect->left = pThis->rctWinView.left
1506  + pThis->iFontWidth * (iStartCol - pThis->rctView.left); // can be negative
1507 
1508  if(iEndCol < 0)
1509  {
1510  pRect->right = INT_MAX;
1511  }
1512  else
1513  {
1514  pRect->right = pThis->iFontWidth * (iEndCol - iStartCol + 1);
1515  }
1516  }
1517  else
1518  {
1519 // pThis->rctWinView.top; what did I intend to do here???
1520 
1521  if(iStartRow == iEndRow) // single row
1522  {
1523  pRect->left = pThis->rctWinView.left
1524  + pThis->iFontWidth * (iStartCol - pThis->rctView.left); // can be negative
1525 
1526  if(iEndCol < 0)
1527  {
1528  pRect->right = INT_MAX;
1529  }
1530  else
1531  {
1532  pRect->right = pThis->iFontWidth * (iEndCol - iStartCol + 1);
1533  }
1534 
1535  pRect->top = pThis->rctWinView.top; // already calculated from earlier
1536  pRect->bottom = pRect->top + iFontHeight; // always
1537  }
1538  else // multiple rows implies including the entire line unless ending column is 0 [in which case last line is excluded]
1539  {
1540  // ignore columns, use the entire viewport width
1541  pRect->left = pThis->rctWinView.left;
1542  pRect->right = INT_MAX; //pThis->rctWinView.right;
1543 
1544  iFontHeight = WBTextObjectCalculateLineHeight(pThis->iAsc, pThis->iDesc); // height PLUS inter-line spacing
1545 
1546  pRect->top = pThis->rctWinView.top
1547  + iFontHeight * (iStartRow - pThis->rctView.top);
1548 
1549  if(iEndCol > 0)
1550  {
1551  pRect->bottom = pThis->rctWinView.top
1552  + iFontHeight * (iEndRow + 1 - pThis->rctView.top);
1553  }
1554  else // nothing selected on last row
1555  {
1556  pRect->bottom = pThis->rctWinView.top
1557  + iFontHeight * (iEndRow - pThis->rctView.top);
1558  }
1559 
1560 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - merged rect %d,%d,%d,%d\n", __FUNCTION__,
1561 // pRect->left, pRect->top, pRect->right, pRect->bottom);
1562  }
1563  }
1564 }
1565 
1566 static void __internal_merge_rect(const struct _text_object_ *pThis, WB_RECT *pRect, int iStartRow, int iStartCol, int iEndRow, int iEndCol)
1567 {
1568 WB_RECT rctMerge;
1569 
1570  if(!pRect || !WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
1571  {
1572  if(pRect)
1573  {
1574  memset(pRect, 0, sizeof(*pRect));
1575  }
1576 
1577  return;
1578  }
1579 
1580  __internal_calc_rect(pThis, &rctMerge, iStartRow, iStartCol, iEndRow, iEndCol);
1581 
1582  if(rctMerge.left < pRect->left)
1583  {
1584  pRect->left = rctMerge.left;
1585  }
1586  if(rctMerge.top < pRect->top)
1587  {
1588  pRect->top = rctMerge.top;
1589  }
1590  if(rctMerge.right > pRect->right)
1591  {
1592  pRect->right = rctMerge.right;
1593  }
1594  if(rctMerge.bottom > pRect->bottom)
1595  {
1596  rctMerge.bottom = pRect->bottom;
1597  }
1598 }

1627 static void __internal_init(struct _text_object_ *pThis)

1641  pThis->iCol = 0;

1645  pThis->pUndo = NULL;
1646  pThis->pRedo = NULL;

1648  // get initial default highlight colors
1649

1653

1655 
1656  LOAD_COLOR("selected_bg_color", szHBG, "#0040FF"); // a slightly greenish blue for the 'selected' BG color
1657  LOAD_COLOR("selected_fg_color", szHFG, "white"); // white FG when selected
1658 
1659 #undef LOAD_COLOR
1660 
1661  XParseColor(WBGetDefaultDisplay(), colormap, szHFG, &(pThis->clrHFG));
1662  XAllocColor(WBGetDefaultDisplay(), colormap, &(pThis->clrHFG)); // TODO: calculate missing pieces myself?
1663  XParseColor(WBGetDefaultDisplay(), colormap, szHBG, &(pThis->clrHBG));
1664  XAllocColor(WBGetDefaultDisplay(), colormap, &(pThis->clrHBG)); // TODO: calculate missing pieces myself?
1665  }
1666 
1667  // TODO: do I re-initialize the owner-maintained values? for now, NO!
1668 
1669  if(pThis->pColorContextCallback)
1670  {
1671  pThis->pColorContextCallback(pThis, -1, -1); // to refresh it (or in this case, erase it)
1672  }
1673 }

1689 static void __internal_set_text(struct _text_object_ *pThis, const char *szText, unsigned long cbLen)
1690 {
1691 TEXT_BUFFER *pTemp;
1692 
1693  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
1694  {
1695  // for now, allocate a NEW text buffer and replace the old one with it
1696 
1697  pTemp = WBAllocTextBuffer(szText, cbLen);
1698 
1699  if(pTemp)
1700  {
1701  if(pThis->pText)
1702  {
1703  WBFreeTextBuffer(pThis->pText);
1704  }
1705 
1706  pThis->pText = pTemp; // and I'm spent
1707 
1708  if(pThis->pColorContextCallback)
1709  {
1710  pThis->pColorContextCallback(pThis, -1, -1); // to refresh it
1711  }
1712  }
1713  else
1714  {
1715  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEXT OBJECT: %s - not enough memory for TEXT BUFFER errno=%d (no change)\n", __FUNCTION__, errno);
1716  }
1717  }
1718  else
1719  {
1720  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR - %s - NOT a valid TEXT_OBJECT - %p\n", __FUNCTION__, pThis);
1721  }
1722 }

1724 static int __internal_get_rows(const struct _text_object_ *pThis)
1725 {
1726 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
1727 
1728  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
1729  {
1730  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
1731 
1732  if(pBuf && pBuf->nEntries > 0) // only if NOT empty
1733  {
1734  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE ||
1735  !pBuf->aLines[0] || !*(pBuf->aLines[0])) // strlen(pBuf->aLines[0])) // "blank line"
1736  {
1737  return 1; // for multiline, even a blank line counts as '1'
1738  }
1739 
1740  return pBuf->nEntries + 1; // include the last line (a blank one) in the line count
1741  }
1742  }
1743 
1744  return 0; // assume blank
1745 }
1746 static int __internal_get_cols(struct _text_object_ *pThis)
1747 {
1748 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
1749 int i1;
1750 
1751  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
1752  {
1753  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
1754 
1755  if(pBuf)
1756  {
1757  if(pBuf->nMinMaxCol > pBuf->nMaxCol || !pBuf->nMaxCol || !pBuf->nMinMaxCol)
1758  {
1759  // cache data not valid, so re-evaluate
1760  WBTextBufferRefreshCache(pBuf); // re-calculate
1761  }
1762 
1763  if(pBuf->nMaxCol)
1764  {
1765  if(pBuf->nMaxCol < pThis->iCol) // is my current column past the 'max' column?
1766  {
1767  i1 = pThis->iCol + DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH; // use my current column position
1768  }
1769  else
1770  {
1771  i1 = pBuf->nMaxCol + DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH; // use the 'max' column position
1772  }
1773 
1774  return i1 - (i1 % DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH); // rounded off to 'DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH'
1775  // so if DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH is 8, then 1 becomes 8, 8 becomes 16, etc.
1776  }
1777  }
1778  else if(pThis->iCol > 0) // allow for 'scrolling without any actual data yet'
1779  {
1780  i1 = pThis->iCol + DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH; // use my current column position
1781  return i1 - (i1 % DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH); // rounded off to 'DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH'
1782  }
1783 
1784  // all other conditions fall through and return 0
1785  }
1786 
1787  return 0; // assume blank
1788 }

1890 static void __internal_get_select(const struct _text_object_ *pThis, WB_RECT *pRct)

1906

1910  }

1940 static char* __internal_get_sel_text(const struct _text_object_ *pThis, const WB_RECT *pRct)
1941 {
1942 WB_RECT rctSel;
1943 
1944  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
1945  {
1946  if(pRct)
1947  {
1948  if(pRct->left == pRct->right && pRct->top == pRct->bottom)
1949  {
1950  return NULL; // empty
1951  }
1952  else if(pRct->left < 0) // a flag for 'select all'
1953  {
1954  return __internal_get_selected_text(pThis, -1, -1, -1, -1);
1955  }
1956 
1957  memcpy(&rctSel, pRct, sizeof(rctSel));
1958  }
1959  else
1960  {
1961  if(SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
1962  {
1963  return NULL;
1964  }
1965  else if(SEL_RECT_ALL(pThis))
1966  {
1967  return __internal_get_selected_text(pThis, -1, -1, -1, -1);
1968  }
1969 
1970  memcpy(&rctSel, &(pThis->rctSel), sizeof(rctSel));
1971  }
1972 
1973  NORMALIZE_SEL_RECT(rctSel);
1974 
1975  return __internal_get_selected_text(pThis, rctSel.top, rctSel.left,
1976  rctSel.bottom, rctSel.right);
1977  }
1978  return NULL; // for now
1979 }
1980 static int __internal_get_row(const struct _text_object_ *pThis)

1983  {
1984  return pThis->iRow;
1985  }
1986  return 0; // for now

1988 static void __internal_set_row(struct _text_object_ *pThis, int iRow)
1989 {

1991  {
1992  if(iRow < 0 || !pThis->pText)
1993  {
1994  iRow = 0;
1995  }
1996  else if(iRow > ((TEXT_BUFFER *)pThis->pText)->nEntries)
1997  {
1998  iRow = ((TEXT_BUFFER *)pThis->pText)->nEntries;
1999  }
2000 
2001  pThis->iRow = iRow;
2002  }
2003 }
2004 static int __internal_get_col(const struct _text_object_ *pThis)

2007  {
2008  return pThis->iCol;
2009  }
2010  return 0; // for now
2011 }
2012 static void __internal_set_col(struct _text_object_ *pThis, int iCol)
2013 {
2014 int iAutoScrollWidth = AUTO_HSCROLL_SIZE;
2015 
2016  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
2017  {
2018  pThis->iCol = iCol; // for now, assign "as-is"
2019 
2020  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE && // single-line, do auto-scrolling
2021  pThis->rctView.right > pThis->rctView.left) // in case the view area is empty
2022  {
2023  while(iAutoScrollWidth > 1 && iAutoScrollWidth >= pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left)
2024  {
2025  iAutoScrollWidth >>= 1;
2026  }
2027 
2028  // scroll left/right to expose the cursor
2029 
2030  while(pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
2031  {
2032  pThis->rctView.left -= iAutoScrollWidth;
2033  pThis->rctView.right -= iAutoScrollWidth;
2034  }
2035  while(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
2036  {
2037  pThis->rctView.left += iAutoScrollWidth;
2038  pThis->rctView.right += iAutoScrollWidth;
2039  }
2040  }
2041  }
2042 }
2043 static void __internal_del_select(struct _text_object_ *pThis)
2044 {
2045 char *pTemp, *pL;
2046 int iSelAll, iLen, i1, i2;
2047 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
2048 WB_RECT rctSel;
2049 
2050 
2051  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
2052  {
2053  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 0);
2054  pThis->iBlinkState = 0; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
2055 
2056  iSelAll = SEL_RECT_ALL(pThis); // identifies "select all"
2057 
2058  if(!iSelAll && SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
2059  {
2060  // no selection, do nothing
2061  return;
2062  }
2063 
2064  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
2065 
2066  if(!pBuf || (pThis->rctSel.top >= pBuf->nEntries && pThis->rctSel.bottom >= pBuf->nEntries))
2067  {
2068  return; // NO buffer, or select area is outside of buffer area
2069  }
2070 
2071  // for the undo buffer I will need a copy of the original text.
2072  // this function only returns NULL on error
2073 
2074  memcpy(&rctSel, &(pThis->rctSel), sizeof(rctSel));
2075 
2076  if(iSelAll)
2077  {
2078  pTemp = __internal_get_selected_text(pThis, -1, -1, -1, -1);
2079  }
2080  else
2081  {
2082  NORMALIZE_SEL_RECT(rctSel);
2083 
2084  pTemp = __internal_get_selected_text(pThis, rctSel.top, rctSel.left,
2085  rctSel.bottom, rctSel.right);
2086  }
2087 
2088  if(iSelAll)
2089  {
2090  // delete all
2091  if(pThis->pText)
2092  {
2093  WBFreeTextBuffer(pThis->pText);
2094  pThis->pText = NULL;
2095  }
2096 
2097  if(pTemp)
2098  {
2099  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_DELETE, pThis->iSelMode,
2100  0, 0, &(pThis->rctSel), pTemp, -1,
2101  pBuf->nEntries, 0, NULL, NULL, 0);
2102  }
2103  }
2104  else if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE ||
2105  rctSel.top == rctSel.bottom) // single-line selection (all methods behave the same)
2106  {
2107  // delete from rctSel.left to rctSel.right (exclusive)
2108 
2109  pL = pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top];
2110 
2111  if(pL)
2112  {
2113  iLen = WBGetMBLength(pL);
2114  if(iLen >= rctSel.left)
2115  {
2116  if(iLen <= rctSel.right)
2117  {
2118  char *pTempL = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, rctSel.left, NULL);
2119  if(pTempL)
2120  {
2121  *pTempL = 0; // just truncate the string
2122  }
2123  }
2124  else
2125  {
2126  char *pTempL = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, rctSel.left, NULL);
2127  char *pTempR = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, rctSel.right, NULL);
2128 
2129  if(pTempL && pTempR)
2130  {
2131  strcpy(pTempL, pTempR); // thereby squeezing the string together and deleting the selection
2132  }
2133  }
2134  }
2135  }
2136 
2137  if(pTemp)
2138  {
2139  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_DELETE, pThis->iSelMode,
2140  rctSel.top, rctSel.left, &(pThis->rctSel),
2141  pTemp, -1,
2142  rctSel.bottom, rctSel.right, NULL, NULL, 0);
2143  }
2144 
2145  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE && // special case, auto-hscroll
2146  pThis->rctView.right > pThis->rctView.left)
2147  {
2148  int iAutoScrollWidth = AUTO_HSCROLL_SIZE;
2149 
2150  while(iAutoScrollWidth > 1 && iAutoScrollWidth >= pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left)
2151  {
2152  iAutoScrollWidth >>= 1;
2153  }
2154 
2155  // scroll left/right to expose the cursor
2156 
2157  while(pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
2158  {
2159  pThis->rctView.left -= iAutoScrollWidth;
2160  pThis->rctView.right -= iAutoScrollWidth;
2161  }
2162  while(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
2163  {
2164  pThis->rctView.left += iAutoScrollWidth;
2165  pThis->rctView.right += iAutoScrollWidth;
2166  }
2167  }
2168  }
2169  else if(pThis->iSelMode == SelectMode_BOX) // multiline delete BOX mode
2170  {
2171  }
2172  else if(pThis->iSelMode == SelectMode_LINE) // multiline delete LINE mode
2173  {
2174  }
2175  else // default 'char'
2176  {
2177  if(pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top] && rctSel.left > 0)
2178  {
2179  pL = pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top];
2180 
2181  if(rctSel.right > 0)
2182  {
2183  char *pJoin, *pNew;
2184 
2185  pJoin = WBGetMBCharPtr(pBuf->aLines[rctSel.bottom], rctSel.right, NULL);
2186  pNew = WBJoinMBLine(pL, rctSel.left, pJoin);
2187 
2188  if(!pNew) // error
2189  {
2190  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR - %s - memory allocation error, errno=%d\n", __FUNCTION__, errno);
2191  return; // no undo buffer when there's a memory error
2192  }
2193  pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top] = pNew;
2194  if(pL) // just in case
2195  {
2196  WBFree(pL);
2197  }
2198 
2199  i2 = rctSel.bottom + 1; // start copying the NEXT line
2200  }
2201  else
2202  {
2203  char *pTemp = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, rctSel.left, NULL);
2204  if(pTemp) // just in case
2205  {
2206  *pTemp = 0; // truncate line at this position
2207  }
2208 
2209  i2 = rctSel.bottom; // start copying THIS line (since I'm not joining them)
2210  }
2211 
2212  for(i1=pThis->rctSel.top + 1; i2 < pBuf->nEntries; i1++, i2++)
2213  {
2214  if(pBuf->aLines[i1])
2215  {
2216  WBFree(pBuf->aLines[i1]);
2217  }
2218  pBuf->aLines[i1] = pBuf->aLines[i2];
2219  pBuf->aLines[i2] = NULL; // for now, to prevent accidental pointer re-use later
2220  }
2221 
2222  pBuf->nEntries = i1;
2223  }
2224  else
2225  {
2226  if(rctSel.right == 0) // an even number of lines is being deleted
2227  {
2228  for(i1=rctSel.top, i2=rctSel.bottom; i2 < pBuf->nEntries; i1++, i2++)
2229  {
2230  if(pBuf->aLines[i1])
2231  {
2232  WBFree(pBuf->aLines[i1]);
2233  }
2234  pBuf->aLines[i1] = pBuf->aLines[i2];
2235  pBuf->aLines[i2] = NULL; // for now, to prevent accidental pointer re-use later
2236  }
2237 
2238  pBuf->nEntries = i1;
2239  }
2240  else // uneven lines
2241  {
2242  // top line will become partial bottom line
2243  pL = pBuf->aLines[rctSel.bottom];
2244 
2245  if(pL)
2246  {
2247  char *pTempR = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, rctSel.right, NULL);
2248  if(pTempR)
2249  {
2250  strcpy(pL, pTempR);
2251  }
2252  else
2253  {
2254  *pL = 0; // for now, truncate the line if this happens
2255  }
2256  }
2257 
2258  if(pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top])
2259  {
2260  WBFree(pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top]);
2261  pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top] = NULL; // by convention (it's re-assigned in the next line though)
2262  }
2263 
2264  pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top] = pL;
2265  pBuf->aLines[rctSel.bottom] = NULL; // by convention, to prevent re-use of pointer
2266 
2267  for(i1=rctSel.top + 1, i2=rctSel.bottom + 1; i2 < pBuf->nEntries; i1++, i2++)
2268  {
2269  if(pBuf->aLines[i1])
2270  {
2271  WBFree(pBuf->aLines[i1]);
2272  pBuf->aLines[i1] = NULL; // by convention (re-assigned in next line)
2273  }
2274 
2275  pBuf->aLines[i1] = pBuf->aLines[i2];
2276  pBuf->aLines[i2] = NULL; // by convention, to prevent accidental pointer re-use later
2277  }
2278 
2279  pBuf->nEntries = i1;
2280  }
2281  }
2282 
2283  if(pTemp)
2284  {
2285  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_DELETE, pThis->iSelMode,
2286  rctSel.top, rctSel.left, &(pThis->rctSel),
2287  pTemp, -1,
2288  rctSel.bottom, rctSel.right, NULL, NULL, 0);
2289  }
2290  }
2291 
2292  if(pTemp)
2293  {
2294  WBFree(pTemp);
2295  }
2296 
2297  // once the selection has been deleted, select 'nothing' and re-paint all
2298  // and of course, iRow and iCol will be at the left/top of the selection
2299 
2300  // NOTE: this assumes that the data is consistent
2301 
2302  pThis->rctSel.left = pThis->rctSel.top = pThis->rctSel.right = pThis->rctSel.bottom = 0;
2303 
2304  if(iSelAll)
2305  {
2306  pThis->iRow = pThis->iCol = 0;
2307  }
2308  else
2309  {
2310  pThis->iRow = rctSel.top;
2311  pThis->iCol = rctSel.left;
2312  }
2313 
2314  if(pThis->pColorContextCallback)
2315  {
2316  pThis->pColorContextCallback(pThis, -1, -1); // to refresh it
2317  }
2318 
2319  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // TODO: optimize this
2320  }
2321 }
2322 static void __internal_replace_select(struct _text_object_ *pThis, const char *szText, unsigned long cbLen)
2323 {
2324 WB_RECT rctSel;
2325 int iSelAll;
2326 
2327  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
2328  {
2329  int iOldIns; //, iOldRow, iOldCol;
2330 
2331  if(pThis->iRow < 0 || pThis->iCol< 0)
2332  {
2333  pThis->iRow = 0;
2334  pThis->iCol = 0;
2335  }
2336 
2337 // NOTE: iOldRow and iOldCol not being used; commented out because of linux gcc warnings
2338 // iOldRow = pThis->iRow;
2339 // iOldCol = pThis->iCol;
2340  iOldIns = pThis->iInsMode;
2341 
2342  iSelAll = SEL_RECT_ALL(pThis);
2343 
2344  memcpy(&rctSel, &(pThis->rctSel), sizeof(rctSel));
2345 
2346  if(iSelAll)
2347  {
2348  pThis->iRow = 0;
2349  pThis->iCol = 0;
2350  }
2351  else if(!SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
2352  {
2353  NORMALIZE_SEL_RECT(rctSel);
2354 
2355  pThis->iRow = rctSel.top;
2356  pThis->iCol = rctSel.left;
2357  }
2358 
2359  pThis->iInsMode = InsertMode_INSERT;
2360 
2361  // TODO: if box mode, height/width may need to match. for now, don't care
2362 
2363  if(!iSelAll && SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis)) // not 'ALL'
2364  {
2365  __internal_ins_chars(pThis, szText, cbLen); // just insert the text (no selection)
2366 
2367  // NOTE: select rectangle remains empty
2368  }
2369  else
2370  {
2371  // for now delete the selection, then insert the new characters
2372  // this will take into consideration the select mode
2373  __internal_del_select(pThis); // this also clears the selection
2374 
2375  // new selection starts at rctSel.top, rctSel.left
2376 
2377  __internal_ins_chars(pThis, szText, cbLen); // just insert the text (no selection)
2378 
2379  // new selection ends at iRow, iCol
2380 
2381  rctSel.right = pThis->iRow;
2382  rctSel.bottom = pThis->iCol;
2383 
2384  // assign the new select rectangle to become the text I just added.
2385  memcpy(&(pThis->rctSel), &rctSel, sizeof(pThis->rctSel));
2386  }
2387 
2388 // pThis->iRow = iOldRow;
2389 // pThis->iCol = iOldCol;
2390  pThis->iInsMode = iOldIns;
2391 
2392  // todo: mark a NEW selection using the inserted text? this might mean replicating code for
2393  // __internal_del_select and __internal_ins_chars and processing undo here
2394 
2395 
2396  if(pThis->pColorContextCallback)
2397  {
2398  pThis->pColorContextCallback(pThis, -1, -1); // to refresh it
2399  }
2400 
2401  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // TODO: optimize this
2402  }
2403 }
2404 static void __internal_del_chars(struct _text_object_ *pThis, int nChar)
2405 {
2406 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
2407 int i1, i2, iLen;
2408 char *pL, *pL2, *pL3;
2409 WB_RECT rctInvalid;
2410 
2411 
2412  if(!nChar)
2413  {
2414  return; // does nothing
2415  }
2416 
2417  // NOTE: nChar < 0 deletes to the left (like a backspace), >0 deletes to the right like 'Del' normally would
2418  // If the cursor is at the end of the line or the start of the line, an appropriate delete will
2419  // merge the previous (or next) line. Values of |nChar| greater than the number of characters remaining
2420  // in the line (from the cursor) _STOP_ at the beginning/end of the line. Only a delete with cursor
2421  // AT the beginning or end of the line will merge. Merge also considers the virtual cursor position.
2422 
2423  if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
2424  {
2425  return; // error
2426  }
2427 
2428  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 0);
2429  pThis->iBlinkState = 0; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
2430 
2431  if(nChar > 0 || (pThis->iCol == 0 && pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE))
2432  {
2433  __internal_calc_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol + 1);
2434  }
2435  else if(pThis->iCol > 0) // backspace, don't merge lines
2436  {
2437  __internal_calc_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol - 1, pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol);
2438  }
2439  else if(pThis->iLineFeed != LineFeed_NONE)
2440  {
2441  __internal_calc_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, pThis->iRow - 1, 0, -1, -1);
2442  }
2443 
2444 
2445  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
2446 
2447  if(!pBuf || !pBuf->nEntries || pThis->iRow > pBuf->nEntries ||
2448  (pThis->iRow == pBuf->nEntries && nChar > 0)) // ending row only allows a backspace from the 1st column
2449  {
2450  return; // do nothing
2451  }
2452 
2453  while(nChar) // while I have characters to delete
2454  {
2455  // if I hit a limit and 'nChar' is still non-zero, break out and return anyway
2456 
2457  if(pThis->iRow > pBuf->nEntries || pThis->iRow < 0) // allow row == nEntries
2458  {
2459  return; // empty
2460  }
2461 
2462  pL = pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow];
2463 
2464  iLen = WBGetMBLength(pL);
2465 
2466  if(nChar < 0 && pThis->iCol == 0 && // backspace prior to beginning of line
2467  (pThis->iRow <= 0 || pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE)) // single line and backspace past begin of column
2468  {
2469  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - backspace while I'm at start of file\n", __FUNCTION__);
2470  return; // exit
2471  }
2472 
2473  if(nChar > 0 && pThis->iCol >= iLen && // delete past end of line
2474  (pThis->iRow >= pBuf->nEntries ||
2475  pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE)) // single line and backspace past begin of column
2476  {
2477  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - delete while I'm past end of file\n", __FUNCTION__);
2478 
2479  return; // exit
2480  }
2481 
2482  // if it's at an edge, merge lines
2483 
2484  if(pThis->iRow > 0 && nChar < 0 && pThis->iCol == 0) // backspace while at the start of a line
2485  {
2486  pL2 = pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow - 1];
2487  if(!pL2)
2488  {
2489  pThis->iCol = 0; // a kind of 'fallback' - put column cursor at zero
2490 
2491  pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow - 1] = pL; // move line to THIS position
2492  pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow] = NULL; // pre-emptive, avoid sharing pointers
2493 
2494  pL = NULL;
2495  }
2496  else
2497  {
2498  if(pL) // can be NULL, which is a blank line
2499  {
2500  i2 = WBGetMBLength(pL2); // now THIS is the new column position
2501 
2502  pL2 = WBJoinMBLine(pL2, i2, pL);
2503 
2504  if(!pL2)
2505  {
2506  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - not enough memory to join lines\n", __FUNCTION__);
2507 
2508  return; // do nothing (TODO: error message?)
2509  }
2510 
2511  pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow - 1] = pL2; // the new pointer
2512  }
2513  else
2514  {
2515  i2 = 0;
2516  }
2517 
2518  pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow] = NULL; // pre-emptive, avoid sharing pointers
2519 
2520  pThis->iCol = i2; // the new position (end of previous line)
2521 
2522  WBFree(pL);
2523  pL = NULL; // pre-emptive, avoid shared pointers
2524  }
2525 
2526  // if I hit backspace while on row==nEntries, just move the cursor to the end
2527  // of the previous line. I'm not really deleting anything.
2528  if(pThis->iRow >= pBuf->nEntries)
2529  {
2530  pThis->iRow--;
2531  if(pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow])
2532  {
2533  pThis->iCol = WBGetMBLength(pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow]);
2534  }
2535  }
2536  else
2537  {
2538  // at this point, 'iRow - 1' is the 'replaced' row, so I need to move rows such that
2539  // I start with 'iRow + 1' and assign to 'i1 - 1'. this works.
2540  for(i1=pThis->iRow + 1; i1 < pBuf->nEntries; i1++)
2541  {
2542  pBuf->aLines[i1 - 1] = pBuf->aLines[i1]; // pack them up by one line
2543  }
2544 
2545  pBuf->nEntries--;
2546  pBuf->aLines[pBuf->nEntries] = NULL; // so that pointers aren't accidentally re-used
2547 
2548  pThis->iRow--; // since I moved up
2549  }
2550 
2551  nChar++; // backspacing, so increment
2552 
2553  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_DELETE, pThis->iSelMode,
2554  pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, &(pThis->rctSel),
2555  "\n", 1, // this is what I'm deleting - the newline
2556  pThis->iRow + 1, 0, NULL, NULL, 0);
2557 
2558  __internal_merge_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, pThis->iRow, 0, -1, -1);
2559  }
2560  else if(pThis->iCol >= iLen && nChar > 0 && pThis->iRow < (pBuf->nEntries - 1))
2561  {
2562  pL2 = pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow + 1];
2563 
2564  if(pL2)
2565  {
2566  if(*pL2)
2567  {
2568  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - joining \"%s\" at %d with \"%s\"\n", __FUNCTION__,
2569  pL, pThis->iCol, pL2);
2570 
2571  pL = WBJoinMBLine(pL, pThis->iCol, pL2);
2572 
2573  if(!pL)
2574  {
2575  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - not enough memory to join\n", __FUNCTION__);
2576 
2577  return; // do nothing ELSE
2578  }
2579 
2580  pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow] = pL; // the new pointer
2581  }
2582 
2583  WBFree(pL2);
2584  }
2585 
2586  pBuf->nEntries--;
2587 
2588  // merge UP the lines, starting with 'iRow + 1' getting 'iRow + 2'
2589  for(i1=pThis->iRow + 1; i1 < pBuf->nEntries; i1++)
2590  {
2591  pBuf->aLines[i1] = pBuf->aLines[i1 + 1];
2592  }
2593 
2594  pBuf->aLines[pBuf->nEntries] = NULL; // so that pointers aren't accidentally re-used
2595 
2596  nChar--; // deleting, so decrement
2597 
2598  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_DELETE, pThis->iSelMode,
2599  pThis->iRow, iLen, &(pThis->rctSel),
2600  "\n", 1,
2601  pThis->iRow + 1, 0, NULL, NULL, 0);
2602 
2603 // __internal_merge_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, pThis->iRow, 0, -1, -1); // invalidate entire row and those that follow
2604 
2605  // bug workaround, mark everything 'invalid'
2606  __internal_merge_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, 0, 0, -1, -1);
2607  }
2608  else
2609  {
2610  // OK now that _THAT_ is done, delete "up to the end of the string if needed"
2611  // on either end, depending upon which direction we must travel
2612 
2613  pL = pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow];
2614 
2615 // if(!pL)
2616 // {
2617 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("UNEXPECTED: %s - NULL pointer at row %d\n", __FUNCTION__, pThis->iRow);
2618 //
2619 // return; // do nothing (TODO: error message?)
2620 // }
2621 
2622  // TODO: use WBDelMBChars
2623 
2624  if(nChar < 0 && pThis->iCol > 0)
2625  {
2626  // TODO: handle hard tab translation? For now "leave it"
2627 
2628  i2 = -nChar;
2629  if(i2 > pThis->iCol)
2630  {
2631  i2 = pThis->iCol;
2632  }
2633 
2634  if(pL) // could be NULL
2635  {
2636  // position to which I delete
2637  pL2 = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, pThis->iCol - i2, NULL); // column to which I delete (backspace)
2638  pL3 = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, pThis->iCol, NULL); // position FROM where I delete/backspace
2639 
2640 
2641  // create undo record first, before I actually delete things
2642  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_DELETE, pThis->iSelMode,
2643  pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol + nChar, &(pThis->rctSel),
2644  pL2, pL3 - pL2, // text pointer AND 'true length' in bytes
2645  pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, NULL, NULL, 0);
2646 
2647  strcpy(pL2, pL3); // delete things down
2648  }
2649 
2650  pThis->iCol -= i2;
2651  nChar += i2; // # of characters actually deleted (added 'cause nChar is negative)
2652 
2653  __internal_merge_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, pThis->iRow, -1); // invalidate remainder of row
2654  }
2655  else if(nChar > 0 && iLen > pThis->iCol)
2656  {
2657  // TODO: handle hard tab translation? For now "leave it"
2658 
2659  i2 = nChar;
2660 
2661  if(i2 > iLen - pThis->iCol)
2662  {
2663  i2 = iLen - pThis->iCol;
2664  }
2665 
2666  if(pL)
2667  {
2668  // position to which I delete
2669  pL2 = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, pThis->iCol + i2, NULL); // column to which I delete
2670  pL3 = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, pThis->iCol, NULL); // position FROM where I delete/backspace
2671 
2672  // create undo record first, before I actually delete things
2673  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_DELETE, pThis->iSelMode,
2674  pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, &(pThis->rctSel),
2675  pL3, pL2 - pL3, // text pointer AND 'true length' in bytes
2676  pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol + nChar, NULL, NULL, 0);
2677 
2678  strcpy(pL3, pL2); // delete things down
2679  }
2680 
2681  nChar -= i2;
2682 
2683  // NOTE: column does not change
2684  __internal_merge_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, pThis->iRow, -1); // invalidate remainder of row
2685  }
2686  else
2687  {
2688  // this is a condition that might infinite loop since it doesn't inc/dec nChar
2689  // it was SUPPOSED to be tested for, but wasn't.
2690 
2691  WB_ERROR_PRINT("UNEXPECTED: %s - nChar=%d, iCol=%d, iRow=%d nEntries=%d\n",
2692  __FUNCTION__, nChar, pThis->iCol, pThis->iRow, (int)pBuf->nEntries);
2693 
2694  break;
2695  }
2696  }
2697 
2698  // implement auto-hscroll while deleting
2699 
2700  if(pThis->rctView.right > pThis->rctView.left)
2701  {
2702  if(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol ||
2703  pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
2704  {
2705  int iAutoScrollWidth = AUTO_HSCROLL_SIZE;
2706 
2707  while(iAutoScrollWidth > 1 && iAutoScrollWidth >= pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left)
2708  {
2709  iAutoScrollWidth >>= 1;
2710  }
2711 
2712  // scroll left/right to expose the cursor
2713 
2714  while(pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
2715  {
2716  pThis->rctView.left -= iAutoScrollWidth;
2717  pThis->rctView.right -= iAutoScrollWidth;
2718  }
2719  while(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
2720  {
2721  pThis->rctView.left += iAutoScrollWidth;
2722  pThis->rctView.right += iAutoScrollWidth;
2723  }
2724 
2725  if(pThis->pColorContextCallback) // TODO: if I only need to invalidate one line, should I just do that?
2726  {
2727  pThis->pColorContextCallback(pThis, -1, -1); // to refresh it
2728  }
2729 
2730  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // scrolling, so invalidate everything
2731  }
2732  else
2733  {
2734  if(pThis->pColorContextCallback) // TODO: if I only need to invalidate one line, should I just do that?
2735  {
2736  pThis->pColorContextCallback(pThis, -1, -1); // to refresh it
2737  }
2738 
2739  // for now, always do this
2740  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // scrolling, so invalidate everything
2741 // __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, 1); // invalidate bounding rectangle
2742  }
2743  }
2744  else
2745  {
2746  if(pThis->pColorContextCallback) // assume multi-line
2747  {
2748  pThis->pColorContextCallback(pThis, -1, -1); // to refresh it
2749  }
2750 
2751  // for now, always do this
2752  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // scrolling, so invalidate everything
2753 
2754 // __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, 1); // invalidate bounding rectangle
2755  }
2756  }
2757 }
2758 static void __internal_ins_chars(struct _text_object_ *pThis, const char *pChar, int nChar)
2759 {
2760 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
2761 const char *p1, *p2;
2762 char *pL, *pTemp;
2763 int i1, iLen=0, iMultiLine = 0;
2764 WB_RECT rctInvalid;
2765 
2766 
2767  if(!pChar || !nChar)
2768  {
2769  return;
2770  }
2771 
2772  if(nChar < 0)
2773  {
2774  nChar = strlen(pChar);
2775  }
2776 
2777  p1 = pChar;
2778  p2 = pChar + nChar;
2779 
2780 
2781  // FIRST, see if the insert is single-line or multi-line and act accordingly
2782 
2783  while(p1 < p2)
2784  {
2785  if(*p1 == '\n' || *p1 == '\r')
2786  {
2787  iMultiLine = 1;
2788  break; // this will be used in single-line mode to mark "stop here"
2789  }
2790 
2791  p1++;
2792  }
2793 
2794  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 0); // always do this
2795 
2796  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
2797  {
2798  if(pThis->iRow < 0 || pThis->iCol< 0)
2799  {
2800  pThis->iRow = 0;
2801  pThis->iCol = 0;
2802  }
2803 
2804  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 0);
2805  pThis->iBlinkState = 0; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
2806 
2807  __internal_calc_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, pThis->iRow, -1); // always refresh entire line from 'iCol' forward
2808 
2809  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
2810 
2811  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE) // single line
2812  {
2813  if(iMultiLine)
2814  {
2815  iMultiLine = 0;
2816  p2 = p1; // either end of string, or the position of the newline
2817  }
2818 
2819  p1 = pChar;
2820 
2821  // insert at 'iCol'
2822 
2823  if(!pBuf) // no buffer, so add text now
2824  {
2825  pBuf = pThis->pText = WBAllocTextBuffer(p1, p2 - p1); // this copies the data, too
2826 
2827  pThis->iRow = 0; // always
2828  pThis->iCol = WBGetMBColIndex(p1, p2); // the col index of 'p2' within 'p1' ('MB' length of 'p1 through p2')
2829  // new col will be 'end of string'. by using this value, it's effectively, like pressing 'end' after inserting
2830 
2831  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_INSERT, pThis->iSelMode,
2832  pThis->iRow, 0, &(pThis->rctSel), NULL, 0, // old col was 0, always
2833  pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, NULL, // new col already assigned
2834  p1, p2 - p1); // the new text
2835  }
2836  else if(p2 > p1) // adding text to existing buffer
2837  {
2838  if(pThis->iRow != 0)
2839  {
2840  pThis->iRow = 0; // force it
2841  }
2842 
2843  iLen = 0; // pre-assign for later (so it won't be "unassigned" by accident on error)
2844 
2845  //------------------------------------------------
2846  // calculating buffer size, allocating line buffer
2847  //------------------------------------------------
2848 
2849  if(pBuf->nEntries <= 0 || !pBuf->aLines[0])
2850  {
2851  if(pBuf->nEntries <= 0)
2852  {
2853  pBuf->nEntries = 1; // single-line, always this, but not verifying for now
2854  }
2855 
2856  pL = pBuf->aLines[0] = WBAlloc(pThis->iCol + p2 - p1 + 2);
2857 
2858  if(pL)
2859  {
2860  if(pThis->iCol > 0) // this works because a space is always 1 byte long
2861  {
2862  memset(pL, ' ', pThis->iCol);
2863  pL[pThis->iCol] = 0;
2864  }
2865 
2866  iLen = pThis->iCol;
2867  }
2868  }
2869  else
2870  {
2871  pTemp = pBuf->aLines[0];
2872 
2873  i1 = strlen(pTemp); // the actual length
2874 
2875  iLen = WBGetMBLength(pTemp); // the # of columns
2876 
2877  if(iLen < pThis->iCol)
2878  {
2879  i1 += pThis->iCol - iLen; // add the alloc length for white space following 'iCol'
2880  }
2881 
2882  if(pThis->iInsMode == InsertMode_OVERWRITE &&
2883  iLen >= pThis->iCol) // only if I actually overwrite something
2884  {
2885  if(iLen < pThis->iCol + WBGetMBColIndex(p1, p2)) // will overwrite extend the string??
2886  {
2887  char *pTempC = WBGetMBCharPtr(pTemp, pThis->iCol, NULL);
2888 
2889  if(pTempC)
2890  {
2891  i1 = (pTempC - pTemp) + (p2 - p1); // extent of teh text I'm adding when I overwrite
2892  }
2893  else
2894  {
2895  i1 += p2 - p1; // fallback in case of problems
2896  }
2897  }
2898  }
2899  else
2900  {
2901  i1 += p2 - p1; // I'm extending the string by 'that much'
2902  }
2903 
2904  pL = WBReAlloc(pTemp, i1 + 2);
2905 
2906  if(pL)
2907  {
2908  pBuf->aLines[0] = pL;
2909  }
2910  else
2911  {
2912  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - not enough memory\n", __FUNCTION__);
2913  }
2914  }
2915 
2916  //-------------------------------------------
2917  // copying data into buffer at column 'iCol'
2918  //-------------------------------------------
2919 
2920  if(pL)
2921  {
2922  char *pTempL;
2923  if(iLen < pThis->iCol)
2924  {
2925  pTempL = pL + strlen(pL); // will always be this
2926 
2927  memset(pTempL, ' ', pThis->iCol - iLen); // pad with spaces
2928 
2929  pTempL += pThis->iCol - iLen; // advance the pointer to where 'iCol' is
2930  *pTempL = 0; // make sure it ends in a zero byte
2931  }
2932  else if(iLen > pThis->iCol && // insert 'in the middle'
2933  pThis->iInsMode != InsertMode_OVERWRITE) // NOT overwriting
2934  {
2935  pTempL = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, pThis->iCol, NULL);
2936 
2937  // make room for text
2938  if(WB_LIKELY((iLen - pThis->iCol + 1) > 0)) // probably always true
2939  {
2940  memmove(pTempL + (p2 - p1), pTempL, strlen(pTempL) + 1); // note that this includes the zero byte at the end
2941  }
2942  }
2943  else if((p2 - p1) + pThis->iCol >= iLen) // overwriting AND it extends the buffer?
2944  {
2945  pTempL = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, pThis->iCol, NULL);
2946 
2947  pTempL[p2 - p1] = 0; // I need a terminating zero byte immediately after where the text will go
2948  }
2949 
2950  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_INSERT, pThis->iSelMode,
2951  pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, &(pThis->rctSel),
2952  (pThis->iInsMode == InsertMode_OVERWRITE && pThis->iCol < iLen ?
2953  pL + pThis->iCol : NULL), // for overwrite, it's the original text
2954  (pThis->iInsMode == InsertMode_OVERWRITE && pThis->iCol < iLen ?
2955  p2 - p1 : 0), // length of old text for overwrite
2956  pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol + (p2 - p1), NULL,
2957  p1, p2 - p1); // the new text
2958 
2959  memcpy(pL + pThis->iCol, p1, p2 - p1); // insert the data (but not the terminating zero byte)
2960 
2961  pThis->iCol += WBGetMBColIndex(p1, p2); // always advance the cursor to this point (overwrite OR insert)
2962  }
2963  }
2964 
2965  if(pThis->pColorContextCallback)
2966  {
2967  pThis->pColorContextCallback(pThis, -1, -1); // to refresh it
2968  }
2969  }
2970  else // multi-line text
2971  {
2972 
2973  // TODO: auto-vscroll while inserting text, make sure cursor position is visible
2974 
2975  // insert at 'iCol'
2976 
2977  if(!pBuf) // no buffer, so add text now
2978  {
2979  p1 = pChar;
2980  p2 = pChar + nChar;
2981 
2982  pBuf = pThis->pText = WBAllocTextBuffer(pChar, nChar);
2983 
2984  pThis->iRow = 0; // always
2985  pThis->iCol = nChar; // effectively, like pressing 'end' after inserting
2986 
2987  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_INSERT, pThis->iSelMode,
2988  pThis->iRow, 0, &(pThis->rctSel), NULL, 0, // old col was 0, always
2989  pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, NULL, // new col already assigned
2990  pChar, nChar); // the new text
2991  }
2992  else // add to existing buffer
2993  {
2994  // NOW, parse into 'lines' and add text as needed
2995  const char *p3 = pChar + nChar; // p3 is 'end of text' marker now
2996  p2 = pChar; // also marks 'end of line' for insertion
2997 
2998 
2999  while(p2 < p3)
3000  {
3001  int nTabs = 0;
3002  p1 = p2; // new 'start of line' pointer (for insertion)
3003 
3004  while(p2 < p3 && *p2 != '\n' && *p2 != '\r')
3005  {
3006  if(*p2 == '\t') // hard tab insertion?
3007  {
3008  nTabs++; // count them (for now); this is for allocation purposes
3009 
3010  // NOTE: if hard tabs are supported, I will be storing the white space
3011  // as a special character
3012  }
3013 
3014  p2++;
3015  }
3016 
3017  // p2 now points just past the end of the 'line' I am inserting, and points to
3018  // either a '\r' or a '\n' (which will be inserted)
3019 
3020  // there are 3 scenarious:
3021  // a) inserting a line feed (no text)
3022  // b) inserting text without a line feed
3023  // c) inserting text WITH a line feed (or more than one line feed)
3024  //
3025  // and the insert condition: insert OR overwrite
3026  // a) if overwrite exceeds the length of the line, it appends to the same line.
3027  // b) if overwrite 'overwrites' with a line feed, it acts like 'insert' at that point (gedit does this too)
3028  // c) if insert or overwrite adds a line feed, a new line is created with the remaining text from the line
3029  // and subsequent lines are moved down by 1 to make space for it
3030 
3031  // I'll deal with 'inserting text' first, then the line feed separately
3032 
3033  // TODO: use WBSplitMBLine() if there's a linefeed
3034  // otherwise, WBInsertMBChars()
3035 
3036  if(pBuf->nEntries <= 0 || !pBuf->aLines[0])
3037  {
3038  if(pBuf->nEntries <= 0)
3039  {
3040  pBuf->nEntries = 1; // single-line, always this, but not verifying for now
3041  }
3042 
3043  pL = pBuf->aLines[0] = WBAlloc(pThis->iCol + (p2 - p1)
3044  + nTabs * pThis->iTab // extra space for tabs
3045  + 2); // 2 additional spaces
3046 
3047  if(pL)
3048  {
3049  if(pThis->iCol > 0) // prepend with spaces
3050  {
3051  memset(pL, ' ', pThis->iCol);
3052  }
3053 
3054  pL[pThis->iCol] = 0; // mark end of string
3055 
3056  iLen = pThis->iCol; // in this case it will be
3057  }
3058  }
3059  else
3060  {
3061  pL = NULL; // a flag for success-testing
3062 
3063  if(WBCheckReAllocTextBuffer(&pBuf, 1) || !pBuf)
3064  {
3065  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - not enough memory to add line\n", __FUNCTION__);
3066  }
3067  else
3068  {
3069  pThis->pText = pBuf; // re-assign in case there's a new ptr
3070 
3071  pTemp = pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow];
3072 
3073  // pTemp may be NULL if I'm at the end...
3074  if(pTemp)
3075  {
3076  i1 = strlen(pTemp); // the actual length
3077  iLen = WBGetMBLength(pTemp); // # of columns
3078  }
3079  else
3080  {
3081  i1 = iLen = 0;
3082  }
3083 
3084  if(iLen < pThis->iCol)
3085  {
3086  i1 += pThis->iCol - iLen; // the necessary alloc length
3087  }

3090  && iLen > pThis->iCol)

3095  }
3096  }
3097  else
3098  {
3099  i1 += p2 - p1; // extending string length
3100  }
3101 
3102  if(pTemp)
3103  {
3104  pL = WBReAlloc(pTemp, i1
3105  + nTabs * pThis->iTab // extra space for tabs
3106  + 2); // re-allocate to fit (plus 2 extra chars)
3107  }
3108  else
3109  {
3110  pL = WBAlloc(i1
3111  + nTabs * pThis->iTab // extra space for tabs
3112  + 2); // allocate to fit (plus 2 extra chars)
3113  }
3114 
3115  if(pL)
3116  {
3117  pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow] = pL;
3118  }
3119  else
3120  {
3121  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - not enough memory\n", __FUNCTION__);
3122  }
3123  }
3124  }
3125 
3126  if(pL) // only if above section worked properly
3127  {
3128  if(iLen < pThis->iCol)
3129  {
3130  pTemp = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, iLen, NULL);
3131 
3132  memset(pTemp, ' ', pThis->iCol - iLen); // pad with spaces
3133  pTemp[pThis->iCol - iLen] = 0; // I need a terminating zero byte
3134 
3135  iLen = pThis->iCol;
3136  }
3137  else if(iLen > pThis->iCol && // insert 'in the middle'
3138  pThis->iInsMode != InsertMode_OVERWRITE) // NOT overwriting
3139  {
3140  // make room for text
3141  if(WB_LIKELY((iLen - pThis->iCol + 1) > 0)) // probably always true
3142  {
3143  memmove(pL + pThis->iCol + (p2 - p1), pL + pThis->iCol, iLen - pThis->iCol + 1);
3144  // note that this includes teh zero byte.
3145  }
3146  }
3147  else if((p2 - p1) + pThis->iCol >= iLen)
3148  {
3149  pL[pThis->iCol + p2 - p1] = 0; // I need a terminating zero byte
3150  }
3151 
3152  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_INSERT, pThis->iSelMode,
3153  pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, &(pThis->rctSel),
3154  (pThis->iInsMode == InsertMode_OVERWRITE && pThis->iCol < iLen ?
3155  pL + pThis->iCol : NULL), // for overwrite, it's the original text
3156  (pThis->iInsMode == InsertMode_OVERWRITE && pThis->iCol < iLen ?
3157  p2 - p1 : 0), // length of old text for overwrite
3158  pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol + (p2 - p1), NULL,
3159  p1, p2 - p1); // the new text
3160 
3161  memcpy(pL + pThis->iCol, p1, p2 - p1); // insert the data
3162 
3163  // the end of the loop
3164 
3165  if(p2 > p1)
3166  {
3167  pThis->iCol += p2 - p1; // always advance the cursor to this point (overwrite OR insert)
3168  }
3169 
3170  // if last char is a newline, split the line at 'iCol'
3171 
3172  if(p2 < p3 && (*p2 == '\r' || *p2 == '\n')) // a newline
3173  {
3174  char c1 = *p2;
3175 
3176  p2++; // advance past the newline
3177 
3178  if(p2 < p3 && *p2 != c1 &&
3179  (*p2 == '\r' || *p2 == '\n')) // CRLF or LFCR
3180  {
3181  p2++; // skip this one too
3182  }
3183 
3184  // insert a new row after this one. But first, does pBuf have enough space?
3185 
3186  if(WBCheckReAllocTextBuffer(&pBuf, 1) || !pBuf)
3187  {
3188  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - not enough memory to add line\n", __FUNCTION__);
3189 
3190  break; // bust out of loop - cannot insert any more
3191  }
3192  else
3193  {
3194  pThis->pText = pBuf; // re-assign in case there's a new ptr
3195 
3196  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - split line, %d, %d, %d\n", __FUNCTION__,
3197  pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, (int)pBuf->nEntries);
3198 
3199  for(i1=pBuf->nEntries; i1 > (pThis->iRow + 1); i1--)
3200  {
3201  pBuf->aLines[i1] = pBuf->aLines[i1 - 1]; // make room for new line
3202  }
3203 
3204  pBuf->nEntries++;
3205 
3206  // TODO: if insert blank line, do I just leave it 'NULL' and not make a copy?
3207 
3208  pTemp = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, pThis->iCol, NULL); // point at which I insert the newline
3209 
3210  pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow + 1] = WBCopyString(pTemp); // make a copy of previous at "that point"
3211  *pTemp = 0; // terminate line at "that point" (TODO: trim right?)
3212 
3213  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - split line into \"%s\", \"%s\"\n", __FUNCTION__,
3214  pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow],
3215  pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow + 1]);
3216 
3217 
3218  pThis->iRow++; // advance row position
3219  pThis->iCol = 0; // newline forces column 0, always
3220 
3221  }
3222  }
3223  }
3224  }
3225  }
3226 
3227  if(pThis->pColorContextCallback) // TODO: if I only need to invalidate one line, should I just do that?
3228  {
3229  pThis->pColorContextCallback(pThis, -1, -1); // to refresh it
3230  }
3231 
3232  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // so invalidate everything (for NOW)
3233  }
3234 
3235  // auto-hscroll while inserting text, make sure cursor position is visible
3236 
3237  if(pThis->rctView.right > pThis->rctView.left)
3238  {
3239  if(iMultiLine ||
3240  pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol ||
3241  pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
3242  {
3243  int iAutoScrollWidth = AUTO_HSCROLL_SIZE;
3244 
3245  while(iAutoScrollWidth > 1 && iAutoScrollWidth >= pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left)
3246  {
3247  iAutoScrollWidth >>= 1;
3248  }
3249 
3250  // scroll left/right to expose the cursor
3251 
3252  while(pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
3253  {
3254  pThis->rctView.left -= iAutoScrollWidth;
3255  pThis->rctView.right -= iAutoScrollWidth;
3256  }
3257  while(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
3258  {
3259  pThis->rctView.left += iAutoScrollWidth;
3260  pThis->rctView.right += iAutoScrollWidth;
3261  }
3262 
3263  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // scrolling, so invalidate everything
3264  }
3265  else
3266  {
3267  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, 1); // invalidate bounding rectangle
3268  }
3269  }
3270  else
3271  {
3272  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // invalidate everything (confusion handler)
3273  }
3274  }
3275 }
