3339 static void __internal_mouse_click(struct _text_object_ *pThis, int iMouseXDelta, int iMouseYDelta, int iType, int iACS)
3340 {
3341 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
3342 int iRow = -1, iCol = -1; // pre-assign error returns
3343 int iFontHeight;
3344 WB_RECT rctSel;
3345 
3346  // NOTE: if this has never been painted, I can't respond to this request
3347 
3348  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
3349  {
3350  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
3351 
3352  memset(&rctSel, 0, sizeof(rctSel));
3353 
3354  if(!(pThis->iDragState & DragState_MOUSE)) // not mouse-dragging at the moment
3355  {
3356  // clear the selection if there is one
3357  if(!SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
3358  {
3359  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, &(pThis->rctHighLight), 0); // invalidate the highlight rectangle
3360  memset(&(pThis->rctSel), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctSel));
3361  memset(&(pThis->rctHighLight), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctHighLight));
3362  }
3363  }
3364 
3365  iFontHeight = pThis->iAsc + pThis->iDesc;
3366 
3367  if(iFontHeight && pThis->iFontWidth &&
3368  pThis->rctWinView.left < pThis->rctWinView.right &&
3369  pThis->rctWinView.top < pThis->rctWinView.bottom)
3370  {
3371  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE) // i.e. "single line"
3372  {
3373  iRow = 0; // always
3374  }
3375  else
3376  {
3377  iFontHeight = WBTextObjectCalculateLineHeight(pThis->iAsc, pThis->iDesc);
3378 
3379  iRow = pThis->rctView.top
3380  + (iMouseYDelta + iFontHeight / 4 - pThis->rctWinView.top) / iFontHeight;
3381 
3382  if(iRow < 0 || !pBuf)
3383  {
3384  iRow = 0;
3385  }
3386  else if(iRow > pBuf->nEntries)
3387  {
3388  iRow = pBuf->nEntries;
3389  }
3390  }
3391 
3392  // column calculation is no different between single-line and multi-line
3393  iCol = pThis->rctView.left
3394  + (iMouseXDelta + pThis->iFontWidth / 4 - pThis->rctWinView.left) / pThis->iFontWidth;
3395 
3396  if(iCol < 0 || !pBuf || iRow >= pBuf->nEntries || !pBuf->aLines[iRow])
3397  {
3398  iCol = 0; // for now also force column 0 if there's no buffer or a NULL entry for it or at end of document
3399  }
3400  else if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE &&
3401  iCol > WBGetMBLength(pBuf->aLines[iRow]))
3402  {
3403  iCol = WBGetMBLength(pBuf->aLines[iRow]); // don't select pos past end of line for single-line edit
3404  }
3405  }
3406 
3407  // if I am doing a mouse-drag, and the selection is empty, start a new selection.
3408  // if I am doing a cursor-drag, disable it.
3409 
3410  if(pThis->iDragState & DragState_CURSOR)
3411  {
3412  pThis->iDragState = DragState_NONE; // turn it off now.
3413 
3414  if(iType == WB_POINTER_BUTTON1 && iACS == 0) // only if left-click for now
3415  {
3416  pThis->iCol = iCol;
3417  pThis->iRow = iRow;
3418  }
3419  }
3420  else if(!(pThis->iDragState & DragState_MOUSE))
3421  {
3422  if(iType == WB_POINTER_BUTTON1 && iACS == 0) // only if left-click for now
3423  {
3424  pThis->iCol = iCol;
3425  pThis->iRow = iRow;
3426  }
3427  else
3428  {
3429  pThis->iDragState = DragState_NONE; // turn dragging off
3430 
3431  // TODO: check for wheel buttons WB_POINTER_BUTTON4 and WB_POINTER_BUTTON5 ?
3432  }
3433  }
3434  else if(iType == 0 && iACS == 0) // a mouse motion message while dragging
3435  {
3436  // see if the select rectangle is empty. If it is, then I
3437  // am just starting the drag and I need to anchor the cursor
3438 
3439  // NOTE: cursor anchor is always (left,top) even if it's a negative distance
3440 
3441  if(SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
3442  {
3443  pThis->rctSel.top = pThis->iRow; // old row
3444  pThis->rctSel.left = pThis->iCol; // previous column
3445  }
3446 
3447  pThis->rctSel.bottom = iRow; // new row
3448  pThis->rctSel.right = iCol; // new column
3449 
3450  pThis->iCol = iCol;
3451  pThis->iRow = iRow;
3452  }
3453  else
3454  {
3455  // TODO: cancel dragging? or not... [maybe check for right-click or scroll]
3456 
3457  // TODO: check for wheel buttons WB_POINTER_BUTTON4 and WB_POINTER_BUTTON5 ?
3458  // for a mouse drag I may enable this, but probably should just shut off the drag
3459  // maybe shift+wheel would select...? testing it shows that it scrolls the viewport
3460 
3461  pThis->iDragState = DragState_NONE; // turn dragging off, for now
3462  }
3463 
3464  // for now mouse-click invalidates the entire rectangle. Later I fix this.
3465 
3466  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // POOBAH
3467  }
3468 }

3485 static void __internal_cursor_up(struct _text_object_ *pThis)
3486 {
3487 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
3488 //int iPageHeight;
3489 
3490 
3491  if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
3492  {
3493  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %p - invalid text object %p\n", __FUNCTION__, pThis);
3494  }
3495  else
3496  {
3497  int iOldRow = pThis->iRow;
3498 
3499  pThis->iBlinkState = 0; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
3500 
3501  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE) // single line
3502  {
3503  return; // do nothing
3504  }
3505 
3506  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - here I am at line %d\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
3507 
3508  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 0); // invalidate current cursor rectangle
3509 
3510  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
3511 
3512  if(!pBuf)
3513  {
3514  pThis->iRow = 0;
3515  pThis->iCol = 0;
3516  }
3517  else if(pBuf->nEntries < pThis->iRow)
3518  {
3519  pThis->iRow = pBuf->nEntries;
3520  pThis->iCol = 0;
3521  }
3522  else if(pThis->iRow > 0)
3523  {
3524  pThis->iRow--;
3525  }
3526  else
3527  {
3528  pThis->iRow = 0;
3529  }
3530 
3531  if(pThis->iDragState & DragState_CURSOR)
3532  {
3533  if(SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
3534  {
3535  pThis->rctSel.left = pThis->iCol;
3536  pThis->rctSel.top = iOldRow;
3537  }
3538 
3539  pThis->rctSel.right = pThis->iCol;
3540  pThis->rctSel.bottom = pThis->iRow;
3541  }
3542  else
3543  {
3544  // clear the selection if there is one
3545  if(!SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
3546  {
3547  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, &(pThis->rctHighLight), 0); // invalidate the highlight rectangle
3548  memset(&(pThis->rctSel), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctSel));
3549  memset(&(pThis->rctHighLight), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctHighLight));
3550  }
3551  }
3552 
3553  if(pThis->rctView.top > pThis->iRow ||
3554  pThis->rctView.bottom <= pThis->iRow)
3555  {
3556  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // scrolling invalidates all
3557 
3558 #if 0 /* it was the way I did it, but no longer */
3559  iPageHeight = pThis->rctView.bottom - pThis->rctView.top - 1;
3560 
3561  // scroll up/down to expose the cursor
3562 
3563  if(iPageHeight > 0)
3564  {
3565  while(pThis->rctView.top > pThis->iRow)
3566  {
3567  pThis->rctView.top -= iPageHeight;
3568  pThis->rctView.bottom -= iPageHeight;
3569  }
3570 
3571  while(pThis->rctView.bottom <= pThis->iRow)
3572  {
3573  pThis->rctView.top += iPageHeight;
3574  pThis->rctView.bottom += iPageHeight;
3575  }
3576  }
3577 #endif // 0
3578 
3579  // scroll right/left so that I have one additional white space visible
3580  if(pThis->rctView.top > pThis->iRow)
3581  {
3582  pThis->rctView.bottom -= (pThis->rctView.top - pThis->iRow);
3583  pThis->rctView.top = pThis->iRow; // new top row
3584  }
3585  else if(pThis->rctView.bottom <= pThis->iRow)
3586  {
3587  pThis->rctView.top += pThis->iRow + 1 - pThis->rctView.bottom;
3588  pThis->rctView.bottom = pThis->iRow + 1;
3589  }
3590  }
3591  else // re-calculate cursor metrics
3592  {
3593  pThis->iCursorY += WBTextObjectCalculateLineHeight(pThis->iAsc, pThis->iDesc)
3594  * (pThis->iRow - iOldRow); // will effectively subtract
3595 
3596 // (pThis->iAsc + pThis->iDesc
3597 // + pThis->iDesc > MIN_LINE_SPACING * 2 ?
3598 // pThis->iDesc / 2 : MIN_LINE_SPACING)
3599 // * (pThis->iRow - iOldRow);
3600 
3601  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 1); // invalidate the NEW cursor rectangle
3602  }
3603  }
3604 }

3807  pThis->rctView.left = pThis->iCol;
3808  }
3809  else if(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
3810  {
3811  pThis->rctView.left += pThis->iCol + 1 - pThis->rctView.right;
3812  pThis->rctView.right = pThis->iCol + 1;
3813  }
3814 
3815  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // invalidate entire screen if I'm here
3816  }
3817  else // re-calculate cursor metrics
3818  {
3819  pThis->iCursorX += (pThis->iCol - iOldCol) * pThis->iFontWidth; // will effectively subtract
3820 
3821  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 1); // invalidate the NEW cursor rectangle
3822  }
3823  }
3824  else
3825  {
3826  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // invalidate entire screen if I'm here (confusion point)
3827  }
3828  }
3829 }
3830 static void __internal_cursor_right(struct _text_object_ *pThis)
3831 {
3832 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
3833 
3834 
3835  if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
3836  {
3837  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %p - invalid text object %p\n", __FUNCTION__, pThis);
3838  }
3839  else
3840  {
3841  int iOldCol = pThis->iCol;
3842 
3843  pThis->iBlinkState = 0; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
3844 
3845  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 0); // invalidate current cursor rectangle
3846 
3847  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
3848 
3849  if(!pBuf)
3850  {
3851  pThis->iRow = 0;
3852  pThis->iCol = 0;
3853  }
3854  else if(pThis->iCol < 0)
3855  {
3856  pThis->iCol = 0;
3857  }
3858  else if(pThis->iCol < INT_MAX)
3859  {
3860  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE) // single line
3861  {
3862  if(pBuf->nEntries <= 0 || !pBuf->aLines[0])
3863  {
3864  pThis->iCol = 0;
3865  }
3866  else
3867  {
3868  int iLen = WBGetMBLength(pBuf->aLines[0]);
3869 
3870  if(pThis->iRow != 0)
3871  {
3872  pThis->iRow = 0; // force it
3873  }
3874 
3875  // no 'virtual space' for single-line but trailing white space OK
3876 
3877  if(pThis->iCol >= iLen)
3878  {
3879  pThis->iCol = iLen;
3880  }
3881  else
3882  {
3883  pThis->iCol++;
3884  }
3885  }
3886  }
3887  else
3888  {
3889  pThis->iCol ++;
3890  }
3891  }
3892 
3893  if(pThis->iDragState & DragState_CURSOR)
3894  {
3895  if(SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
3896  {
3897  pThis->rctSel.left = iOldCol;
3898  pThis->rctSel.top = pThis->iRow;
3899  }
3900 
3901  pThis->rctSel.right = pThis->iCol;
3902  pThis->rctSel.bottom = pThis->iRow;
3903  }
3904  else
3905  {
3906  // clear the selection if there is one
3907  if(!SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
3908  {
3909  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, &(pThis->rctHighLight), 0); // invalidate the highlight rectangle
3910  memset(&(pThis->rctSel), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctSel));
3911  memset(&(pThis->rctHighLight), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctHighLight));
3912  }
3913  }
3914 
3915  if(pThis->rctView.right > pThis->rctView.left)
3916  {
3917  if(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol ||
3918  pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
3919  {
3920 #if 0 /* this method works better with page right/left and not arrow */
3921  int iAutoScrollWidth = AUTO_HSCROLL_SIZE;
3922 
3923  while(iAutoScrollWidth > 1 && iAutoScrollWidth >= pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left)
3924  {
3925  iAutoScrollWidth >>= 1;
3926  }
3927 
3928  // scroll left/right to expose the cursor
3929 
3930  while(pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
3931  {
3932  pThis->rctView.left -= iAutoScrollWidth;
3933  pThis->rctView.right -= iAutoScrollWidth;
3934  }
3935  while(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
3936  {
3937  pThis->rctView.left += iAutoScrollWidth;
3938  pThis->rctView.right += iAutoScrollWidth;
3939  }
3940 #endif // 0
3941 
3942  // scroll right/left so that I have one additional white space visible
3943  if(pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
3944  {
3945  pThis->rctView.right -= (pThis->rctView.left - pThis->iCol);
3946  pThis->rctView.left = pThis->iCol;
3947  }
3948  else if(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
3949  {
3950  pThis->rctView.left += pThis->iCol + 1 - pThis->rctView.right;
3951  pThis->rctView.right = pThis->iCol + 1;
3952  }
3953 
3954  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // invalidate entire screen if I'm here
3955  }
3956  else // re-calculate cursor metrics
3957  {
3958  pThis->iCursorX += (pThis->iCol - iOldCol) * pThis->iFontWidth;
3959 
3960  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 1); // invalidate the NEW cursor rectangle
3961  }
3962  }
3963  else
3964  {
3965  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // invalidate entire screen if I'm here (confusion point)
3966  }
3967  }
3968 }

4026 static void __internal_cursor_home(struct _text_object_ *pThis)
4027 {
4028 const char *pL, *p2;
4029 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
4030 
4031 
4032  if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
4033  {
4034  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %p - invalid text object %p\n", __FUNCTION__, pThis);
4035  }
4036  else
4037  {
4038  int iOldCol = pThis->iCol;
4039 
4040  pThis->iBlinkState = 0; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
4041 
4042  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 0); // invalidate current cursor rectangle
4043 
4044  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
4045 
4046  if(!pBuf || pThis->iRow >= pBuf->nEntries || pThis->iCol > 0)
4047  {
4048  pThis->iCol = 0;
4049  }
4050  else
4051  {
4052  // find first non-white-space character and assign to THAT
4053  // TODO: handle hard tab translation? For now "leave it"
4054 
4055  pL = pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow];
4056 
4057  if(pL)
4058  {
4059  p2 = pL;
4060  while(*p2 && *p2 <= ' ') // TODO: adjust for 'hard tab' char which might be 'U+00A0'...
4061  {
4062  p2++;
4063  }
4064 
4065  if(*p2)
4066  {
4067  pThis->iCol = (int)(p2 - pL); // toggling 'beginning of line' and column 0
4068  }
4069  }
4070  }
4071 
4072  if(pThis->iDragState & DragState_CURSOR)
4073  {
4074  if(SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
4075  {
4076  pThis->rctSel.left = iOldCol;
4077  pThis->rctSel.top = pThis->iRow;
4078  }
4079 
4080  pThis->rctSel.right = pThis->iCol;
4081  pThis->rctSel.bottom = pThis->iRow;
4082  }
4083  else

4085  // clear the selection if there is one
4086  if(!SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
4087  {
4088  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, &(pThis->rctHighLight), 0); // invalidate the highlight rectangle
4089  memset(&(pThis->rctSel), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctSel));
4090  memset(&(pThis->rctHighLight), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctHighLight));
4091  }
4092  }
4093 
4094  if(pThis->rctView.right > pThis->rctView.left)
4095  {
4096  if(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol ||
4097  pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
4098  {
4099  int iAutoScrollWidth = AUTO_HSCROLL_SIZE;
4100 
4101  while(iAutoScrollWidth > 1 && iAutoScrollWidth >= pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left)
4102  {
4103  iAutoScrollWidth >>= 1;
4104  }
4105 
4106  // scroll left/right to expose the cursor
4107 
4108  while(pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
4109  {
4110 
4111  pThis->rctView.left -= iAutoScrollWidth;
4112  pThis->rctView.right -= iAutoScrollWidth;
4113  }
4114  while(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
4115  {
4116  pThis->rctView.left += iAutoScrollWidth;
4117  pThis->rctView.right += iAutoScrollWidth;
4118  }
4119 
4120  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // invalidate entire screen if I'm here
4121  }
4122  else // re-calculate cursor metrics
4123  {
4124  pThis->iCursorX += (pThis->iCol - iOldCol) * pThis->iFontWidth;
4125 
4126  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 1); // invalidate the NEW cursor rectangle
4127  }
4128  }
4129  else
4130  {
4131  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // invalidate entire screen if I'm here (confusion point)
4132  }
4133  }

4368 static void __internal_scroll_vertical(struct _text_object_ *pThis, int nRows)
4369 {
4370 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
4371 
4372  if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
4373  {
4374  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %p - invalid text object %p\n", __FUNCTION__, pThis);
4375  }
4376  else
4377  {
4378  int iOldRow WB_UNUSED = pThis->iRow; // TODO: do I still need this assignment? For now, mark 'unused' and leave for reference
4379 
4380  pThis->iBlinkState = 0; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
4381 
4382  if(!nRows)
4383  {
4384  return; // do nothing
4385  }
4386 
4387  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
4388 
4389  if(!pBuf)
4390  {
4391  pThis->iRow = 0;
4392  pThis->iCol = 0;
4393 
4394  pThis->rctView.bottom -= pThis->rctView.top; // assuming it's right
4395  pThis->rctView.top = 0;
4396  pThis->rctView.right -= pThis->rctView.left; // assuming it's right
4397  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
4398  }
4399  else if(nRows < 0)
4400  {
4401  if(pThis->rctView.top + nRows < 0)
4402  {
4403  pThis->rctView.bottom -= pThis->rctView.top;
4404  pThis->rctView.top = 0;
4405  }
4406  else
4407  {
4408  pThis->rctView.bottom += nRows;
4409  pThis->rctView.top += nRows;
4410  }
4411  }
4412  else // if(nRows > 0)
4413  {
4414  if(pThis->rctView.bottom + nRows > pBuf->nEntries)
4415  {
4416  pThis->rctView.top += pBuf->nEntries - pThis->rctView.bottom;
4417  pThis->rctView.bottom = pBuf->nEntries;
4418  }
4419  else
4420  {
4421  pThis->rctView.bottom += nRows;
4422  pThis->rctView.top += nRows;
4423  }
4424  }
4425  }
4426 }

4428 static void __internal_scroll_horizontal(struct _text_object_ *pThis, int nCols)
4429 {
4430 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
4431 
4432  if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
4433  {
4434  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %p - invalid text object %p\n", __FUNCTION__, pThis);
4435  }
4436  else
4437  {
4438  int iOldRow WB_UNUSED = pThis->iRow; // TODO: do I still need this assignment? For now, mark 'unused' and leave for reference
4439 
4440  pThis->iBlinkState = 0; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
4441 
4442  if(!nCols)
4443  {
4444  return; // do nothing
4445  }
4446 
4447  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
4448 
4449  if(!pBuf)
4450  {
4451  pThis->iRow = 0;
4452  pThis->iCol = 0;
4453 
4454  pThis->rctView.bottom -= pThis->rctView.top; // assuming it's right
4455  pThis->rctView.top = 0;
4456  pThis->rctView.right -= pThis->rctView.left; // assuming it's right
4457  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
4458  }
4459  else if(pThis->iCol < 0)
4460  {
4461  pThis->iCol = 0; // always
4462 
4463  pThis->rctView.right -= pThis->rctView.left; // assuming it's right
4464  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
4465  }
4466  else if(pThis->iCol + nCols > -INT_MAX && pThis->iCol + nCols < INT_MAX) // for now, ignore scroll on overflow
4467  {
4468  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE) // single line
4469  {
4470  if(pBuf->nEntries <= 0 || !pBuf->aLines[0])
4471  {
4472  pThis->iCol = 0;
4473 
4474  pThis->rctView.right -= pThis->rctView.left; // assuming it's right
4475  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
4476  }
4477  else
4478  {
4479  int iLen = WBGetMBLength(pBuf->aLines[0]);
4480 
4481  if(pThis->iRow != 0)
4482  {
4483  pThis->iRow = 0; // force it
4484  }
4485 
4486  // no 'virtual space' for single-line but trailing white space OK
4487  if(nCols > 0)
4488  {
4489  if(pThis->rctView.right + nCols > iLen + 1)
4490  {
4491  pThis->rctView.left += (iLen + 1 - nCols - pThis->rctView.right);
4492  pThis->rctView.right = iLen + 1;
4493  }
4494  else
4495  {
4496  pThis->rctView.left += nCols;
4497  pThis->rctView.right += nCols;
4498  }
4499  }
4500  else
4501  {
4502  if(pThis->rctView.left + nCols < 0)
4503  {
4504  pThis->rctView.right -= pThis->rctView.left;
4505  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
4506  }
4507  else
4508  {
4509  pThis->rctView.left += nCols;
4510  pThis->rctView.right += nCols;
4511  }
4512  }
4513  }
4514  }
4515  else
4516  {
4517  if(nCols > 0)
4518  {
4519  pThis->rctView.left += nCols; // scroll right always
4520  pThis->rctView.right += nCols;
4521  }
4522  else
4523  {
4524  if(pThis->rctView.left + nCols < 0)
4525  {
4526  pThis->rctView.right -= pThis->rctView.left;
4527  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
4528  }
4529  else
4530  {
4531  pThis->rctView.left += nCols;
4532  pThis->rctView.right += nCols;
4533  }
4534  }
4535  }
4536  }
4537  }
4538 }
4539 
4540 static void __internal_do_expose(struct _text_object_ *pThis, Display *pDisplay, Window wID,
4541  GC gc, const WB_GEOM *pPaintGeom, const WB_GEOM *pViewGeom,
4542  XFontSet rFontSet)
4543 {
4544 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
4545 WB_GEOM geomV, geomP, geomC;
4546 XFontStruct *pFont = NULL, **ppFonts = NULL;
4547 char **ppNames, *pL;
4548 int i1, iLen, iFontHeight, iFontWidth, nFonts, iAsc, iDesc, iX, iY, iPX, iPY;
4549 int iXDelta = 0, iYDelta = 0;
4550 XFontSet fSet;
4551 Pixmap pxTemp;
4552 unsigned long clrFG, clrBG, clrHFG, clrHBG;
4553 GC gc2 = None;
4554 WB_RECT rctSel; // the NORMALIZED selection rectangle (calculated)
4555 
4556 
4557  if(pViewGeom)
4558  {
4559  memcpy(&geomV, pViewGeom, sizeof(geomV));
4560  }
4561  else
4562  {
4563  WBGetWindowGeom(wID, &geomV);
4564 
4565  geomV.x = geomV.y = 0; // ALWAYS (make sure) - it's client coords now
4566 
4567  geomV.y += MIN_BORDER_SPACING; // need a minimum top/bottom border as well
4568  geomV.height -= MIN_BORDER_SPACING * 2;
4569  }
4570 
4571  // in all cases, make room on right/left edges for the cursor
4572 
4573  geomV.x += MIN_BORDER_SPACING; // required for cursor
4574  geomV.width -= MIN_BORDER_SPACING * 2;
4575 
4576  // TODO: make use of geomV's "border" parameter??
4577 
4578  if(geomV.width <= MIN_BORDER_SPACING * 2 || // absolute minimum width
4579  geomV.height <= MIN_BORDER_SPACING * 2) // absolute minimum height
4580  {
4581  return; // can't do window that's way too small
4582  }
4583 
4584  if(pPaintGeom)
4585  {
4586  memcpy(&geomP, pPaintGeom, sizeof(geomP));
4587  }
4588  else
4589  {
4590  memcpy(&geomP, &geomV, sizeof(geomV));
4591  }
4592 
4593  if(rFontSet == None) /* NULL? */
4594  {
4595  pFont = WBGetGCFont(pDisplay, gc);
4596 
4597  if(!pFont)
4598  {
4599  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - ERROR: WBGetGCFont returns NULL\n", __FUNCTION__);
4600 
4601  return; // bad
4602  }
4603 
4604  fSet = WBFontSetFromFont(pDisplay, pFont); // convert font to font set
4605 
4606  XFreeFont(pDisplay, pFont); // free it now (important to do so)
4607  pFont = NULL;
4608 
4609  if(fSet == None)
4610  {
4611  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - ERROR: WBFontSetFromFont returns None\n", __FUNCTION__);
4612 
4613  return; // bad
4614  }
4615  }
4616  else
4617  {
4618  fSet = rFontSet; // I must check for this before I free fSet later
4619  }
4620 
4621  // at this point I must use 'fSet' to do all of the font metrics + drawing
4622 
4623  // NOTE: doing the call directly instead of calling WBFontSetAscent() etc. so only loop once
4624 
4625  nFonts = XFontsOfFontSet(fSet, &ppFonts, &ppNames); // returns # of items (do NOT free resources! They are owned by the font set)
4626 
4627  // TODO: XFontStruct::direction indicates LTR RTL TTB or BTT for painting - for now _ONLY_ LTR_TTB will apply
4628 
4629  if(nFonts <= 0 || !ppFonts) // no fonts?
4630  {
4631  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - ERROR: XFontsOfFontSet returns %d\n", __FUNCTION__, nFonts);
4632 
4633  goto the_end;
4634  }
4635 
4636  // to find the floor of the font, I'll need to determine max iAsc and iDesc
4637 
4638  for(i1=0, iAsc=0, iDesc=0; i1 < nFonts; i1++)
4639  {
4640  if(iAsc < ppFonts[i1]->ascent)
4641  {
4642  iAsc = ppFonts[i1]->ascent;
4643  }
4644  if(iDesc < ppFonts[i1]->descent)
4645  {
4646  iDesc = ppFonts[i1]->descent;
4647  }
4648  }
4649 
4650  // NOW get the font width for a space (TODO: average char width instead?)
4651 
4652  iFontWidth = WB_TEXT_ESCAPEMENT(fSet, " ", 1);
4653 
4654  // get FG/BG color information
4655 
4656  clrFG = WBGetGCFGColor(pDisplay, gc);
4657  clrBG = WBGetGCBGColor(pDisplay, gc);
4658 
4659  // TODO: compare clrHFG and clrHBG to a "NULL" XColor?
4660  if(!memcmp(&pThis->clrHFG, &pThis->clrHBG, sizeof(XColor))) // not assigned (they should never match)
4661  {
4662  clrHBG = clrFG;
4663  clrHFG = clrBG;
4664  }
4665  else
4666  {
4667  clrHBG = pThis->clrHBG.pixel;
4668  clrHFG = pThis->clrHFG.pixel;
4669  }
4670 
4671  // make a copy of the GC since I'm probably going to mess with it
4672 
4673  gc2 = XCreateGC(pDisplay, wID, 0, NULL);
4674 
4675  if(gc2 != None)
4676  {
4677  // NOTE: docs wrong for XCopyGC, header correct - see WBBeginPaint()
4678  if(!XCopyGC(pDisplay, gc, GCAll, gc2))
4679  {
4680  XFreeGC(pDisplay, gc2);
4681  gc2 = None;
4682  }
4683  }
4684 
4685  // font metrics complete. Now THAT wasn't so bad, was it? OK it was but only need to do it here
4686 
4687  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
4688  {
4689  // cache the window ID
4690  pThis->wIDOwner = wID;
4691 
4692  // cache the font metrics
4693  pThis->iAsc = iAsc;
4694  pThis->iDesc = iDesc;
4695  pThis->iFontWidth = iFontWidth;
4696 
4697  iFontHeight = iAsc + iDesc; // does not include interline spacing (that comes later for multi-line only)
4698 
4699 
4700  // keep track of the total viewport in window coordinates.
4701  // this will be used later for mouse translation
4702 
4703  pThis->rctWinView.left = geomV.x;
4704  pThis->rctWinView.top = geomV.y;
4705  pThis->rctWinView.right = pThis->rctWinView.left + geomV.width;
4706  pThis->rctWinView.bottom = pThis->rctWinView.top + geomV.height;
4707 
4708  // cache the pointer to the TEXT BUFFER
4709  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
4710 
4711 
4712  // ------------------------------------------
4713  // CALCULATING THE CORRECT VIEWPORT (rctView)
4714  // ------------------------------------------
4715  //
4716  // NOTE: if the owning window has reset the viewport, the entire window SHOULD
4717  // be invalid. If not, it won't paint properly.
4718 
4719  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE || // SINGLE LINE
4720  !pBuf || pBuf->nEntries <= 0) // also test for this condition and treat it as single-line also (temporary)
4721  {
4722  // AUTO-ASSIGN the viewport whenever right <= left (i.e. viewport is 'NULL' or 'empty')
4723  // or whenever the viewport is not properly assigned (window re-size re-paint)
4724 
4725  if(pThis->rctView.top || pThis->rctView.bottom ||
4726  pThis->rctView.right != pThis->rctView.left + geomV.width / iFontWidth) // not PROPERLY assigned
4727  {
4728  int iAutoScrollWidth = AUTO_HSCROLL_SIZE;
4729 
4730  if(pThis->rctView.left < 0) // not already assigned
4731  {
4732  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
4733  }
4734 
4735  pThis->rctView.top = pThis->rctView.bottom = 0; // single line forces this (always)
4736 
4737  pThis->rctView.right = pThis->rctView.left + geomV.width / iFontWidth;
4738 
4739  if(pThis->rctView.right > pThis->rctView.left)
4740  {
4741  while(iAutoScrollWidth > 1 && iAutoScrollWidth >= pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left)
4742  {
4743  iAutoScrollWidth >>= 1;
4744  }
4745 
4746  // scroll right to expose the cursor
4747 
4748  while(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
4749  {
4750  pThis->rctView.left += iAutoScrollWidth;
4751  pThis->rctView.right += iAutoScrollWidth;
4752  }
4753  }
4754  else
4755  {
4756  pThis->rctView.right = pThis->rctView.left = pThis->iCol; // desperate to have something there
4757  }
4758  }
4759  }
4760  else // MULTI-LINE
4761  {
4762  int iWindowHeightInLines;
4763 
4764  // adjust font height to include line spacing (I'll use this to position the lines)
4765 
4766  iFontHeight = WBTextObjectCalculateLineHeight(pThis->iAsc, pThis->iDesc);
4767 
4768  iWindowHeightInLines = geomV.height / iFontHeight; // window height (in lines)
4769  if(!iWindowHeightInLines)
4770  {
4771  iWindowHeightInLines = 1; // just in case so I don't divide by zero
4772  }
4773 
4774  // AUTO-ASSIGN the viewport whenever right <= left (i.e. viewport is 'NULL' or 'empty')
4775  // or whenever the viewport is not properly assigned (window re-size re-paint)
4776 
4777  // NOTE: in this section, pBuf cannot be NULL
4778 
4779  if(pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left
4780  != geomV.width / iFontWidth // viewport needs re-calculation
4781  || pThis->rctView.bottom - pThis->rctView.top
4782  != iWindowHeightInLines // viewport needs re-calculation
4783  || pThis->rctView.top > pBuf->nEntries) // top exceeds total # of lines
4784  {
4785  int iAutoScrollWidth = AUTO_HSCROLL_SIZE;
4786 
4787  if(pThis->rctView.left < 0) // not already assigned
4788  {
4789  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
4790  }
4791 
4792  if(pThis->rctView.top < 0 || pThis->rctView.top > pBuf->nEntries
4793  || (pThis->rctView.top && pBuf->nEntries < iWindowHeightInLines))
4794  {
4795  pThis->rctView.top = 0; // set viewport to top
4796  }
4797 
4798  if(pThis->rctView.bottom - pThis->rctView.top
4799  != iWindowHeightInLines)
4800  {
4801  pThis->rctView.bottom = pThis->rctView.top + iWindowHeightInLines;
4802 
4803  // always scroll row into view
4804 
4805  while(pThis->rctView.top > pThis->iRow)
4806  {
4807  pThis->rctView.top -= iWindowHeightInLines - 1;
4808  pThis->rctView.bottom -= iWindowHeightInLines - 1;
4809  }
4810  while(pThis->rctView.bottom <= pThis->iRow)
4811  {
4812  pThis->rctView.top += iWindowHeightInLines - 1;
4813  pThis->rctView.bottom += iWindowHeightInLines - 1;
4814  }
4815  }
4816 
4817  if(pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left != geomV.width / iFontWidth)
4818  {
4819  pThis->rctView.right = pThis->rctView.left + geomV.width / iFontWidth;
4820 
4821  if(pThis->rctView.right > pThis->rctView.left) // just in case, test it
4822  {
4823  while(iAutoScrollWidth > 1 && iAutoScrollWidth >= pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left)
4824  {
4825  iAutoScrollWidth >>= 1;
4826  }
4827 
4828  // scroll right to expose the cursor
4829 
4830  while(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
4831  {
4832  pThis->rctView.left += iAutoScrollWidth;
4833  pThis->rctView.right += iAutoScrollWidth;
4834  }
4835  }
4836  else
4837  {
4838  pThis->rctView.right = pThis->rctView.left = pThis->iCol; // desperate to have something there
4839  }
4840  }
4841  }
4842  }
4843 
4844 
4845  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
4846  // convert the highlight rectangle into screen coordinates (fills in rctSel)
4847  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
4848 
4849  if(!SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
4850  {
4851  if(SEL_RECT_ALL(pThis))
4852  {
4853  memcpy(&rctSel, &(pThis->rctView), sizeof(rctSel)); // use entire viewport for hightlight rect
4854  // TODO: single-line, only select to end of string?
4855  }
4856  else
4857  {
4858  memcpy(&rctSel, &(pThis->rctSel), sizeof(rctSel));
4859  NORMALIZE_SEL_RECT(rctSel);
4860  }
4861 
4862  pThis->rctHighLight.left = pThis->rctWinView.left
4863  + (rctSel.left - pThis->rctView.left) * iFontWidth;
4864 
4865  pThis->rctHighLight.top = pThis->rctWinView.top
4866  + (rctSel.top - pThis->rctView.top) * iFontHeight;
4867 
4868  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE)
4869  {
4870  pThis->rctHighLight.top += (geomV.height - iAsc - iDesc) / 2; // since single-line text is centered
4871  }
4872 
4873  pThis->rctHighLight.right = pThis->rctHighLight.left
4874  + (rctSel.right - rctSel.left) * iFontWidth;
4875 
4876  pThis->rctHighLight.bottom = pThis->rctHighLight.top // NOTE add 1 to # of lines, always
4877  + (rctSel.bottom - rctSel.top + 1) * iFontHeight;
4878 
4879  // NOTE: this is independent of the selection method. In the special case
4880  // that a single line or an entire line is selected, I may have
4881  // to handle this differently
4882  }
4883  else
4884  {
4885  bzero(&rctSel, sizeof(rctSel)); // zero out selection rectangle
4886  bzero(&(pThis->rctHighLight), sizeof(pThis->rctHighLight));
4887  }
4888 
4889 
4890  //--------------------------------------------
4891  // CREATE PIXMAP (for speeding up the process)
4892  //--------------------------------------------
4893 
4894  iPX = pThis->rctWinView.right - pThis->rctWinView.left + 2 * MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
4895  iPY = pThis->rctWinView.bottom - pThis->rctWinView.top + 2 * MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
4896 
4897 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s window %u (%08xH) pixmap dimensions %d,%d\n"
4898 // " row/col %d,%d\n",
4899 // __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID, iPX, iPY,
4900 // pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol);
4901 
4902  if(gc2 != None && iPX > 0 && iPY > 0)
4903  {
4904  pxTemp = XCreatePixmap(pDisplay, wID, iPX, iPY,
4905  DefaultDepth(pDisplay, DefaultScreen(pDisplay)));
4906  }
4907  else
4908  {
4909  pxTemp = None;
4910  }
4911 
4912  //-----------------------
4913  // FILL/ERASE BACKGROUND
4914  //-----------------------
4915 
4916  if(pxTemp != None)
4917  {
4918  iXDelta = geomV.x - MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
4919  iYDelta = geomV.y - MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
4920 
4921  // sometimes the clipping origin, when filling the background, might matter, especially if patterns are involved
4922  XSetClipOrigin(pDisplay, gc2, -iXDelta, -iYDelta); // so that it matches the display's clipping in gc
4923 
4924  XSetForeground(pDisplay, gc2, clrBG);
4925  XFillRectangle(pDisplay, pxTemp, gc2, 0, 0, iPX, iPY);
4926 
4927  XSetForeground(pDisplay, gc2, clrFG);
4928  }
4929  else // FALLBACK, if no pixmap, go to window directly
4930  {
4931  iXDelta = iYDelta = 0; // make sure, as they're used in a few places
4932 
4933  XSetForeground(pDisplay, gc, clrBG);
4934  XFillRectangle(pDisplay, wID, gc,
4935  pThis->rctWinView.left,
4936  pThis->rctWinView.top,
4937  pThis->rctWinView.right - pThis->rctWinView.left,
4938  pThis->rctWinView.bottom - pThis->rctWinView.top);
4939 
4940  XSetForeground(pDisplay, gc, clrFG);
4941  }
4942 
4943  // At this point, if pBuf is NULL or the # of entries zero, the background is *STILL* erased
4944 
4945  if(!pBuf || pBuf->nEntries <= 0)
4946  {
4947 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - no text\n", __FUNCTION__);
4948  goto almost_the_end; // I use the goto so I can put cleanup code there - it's safer
4949  }
4950 
4951 
4952  // if it's a single-line object, center it within the window and display only ONE line
4953 
4954  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE) // i.e. SINGLE LINE
4955  {
4957  // SINGLE LINE PAINTING
4959 
4960  iY = geomV.y + (geomV.height - iAsc - iDesc) / 2 + iAsc; // iY is now "the baseline" for the font
4961  iX = geomV.x;
4962 
4963  pL = pBuf->aLines[0];
4964  if(!pL)
4965  {
4966  goto the_end;
4967  }
4968 
4969 
4970  //-----------------------------
4971  // DRAWING HIGHLIGHT RECTANGLE
4972  //-----------------------------
4973 
4974  if(pThis->rctHighLight.right > pThis->rctHighLight.left &&
4975  WBRectOverlapped(pThis->rctHighLight, pThis->rctWinView))
4976  {
4977  if(pxTemp != None)
4978  {
4979  // NOTE: iXDelta and iYDelta were calculated before, when background was erased
4980  // and the clip origin was also assigned for gc2
4981 // XSetClipOrigin(pDisplay, gc2, -iXDelta, -iYDelta); // so that it matches the display's clipping in gc
4982 
4983  XSetForeground(pDisplay, gc2, clrHBG); // highlight background color
4984 
4985  XFillRectangle(pDisplay, pxTemp, gc2,
4986  pThis->rctHighLight.left - iXDelta,
4987  pThis->rctHighLight.top - iYDelta,
4988  pThis->rctHighLight.right - pThis->rctHighLight.left,
4989  pThis->rctHighLight.bottom - pThis->rctHighLight.top);
4990 
4991  XSetForeground(pDisplay, gc2, clrFG);
4992  }
4993  else // FALLBACK, if no pixmap, go to window directly
4994  {
4995  XSetForeground(pDisplay, gc, clrHBG); // highlight background color
4996 
4997  XFillRectangle(pDisplay, wID, gc,
4998  pThis->rctHighLight.left,
4999  pThis->rctHighLight.top,
5000  pThis->rctHighLight.right - pThis->rctHighLight.left,
5001  pThis->rctHighLight.bottom - pThis->rctHighLight.top);
5002 
5003  XSetForeground(pDisplay, gc, clrFG);
5004  }
5005  }
5006 
5007  //---------------------------------------
5008  // DRAW the text and the vertical cursor
5009  //---------------------------------------
5010 
5011  iLen = WBGetMBLength(pL);
5012 
5013  pThis->iCursorX = pThis->iCursorY = pThis->iCursorHeight = 0; // to indicate "not drawn"
5014 
5015  for(i1=pThis->rctView.left; i1 < pThis->rctView.right; i1++, iX += iFontWidth)
5016  {
5017  WB_RECT rctChar, rctCursor;
5018 
5019  if(i1 == pThis->iCol) // display the cursor (NOTE: row ALWAYS matches)
5020  {
5021  pThis->iCursorX = iX - 1;
5022 
5023  if(pThis->iInsMode == InsertMode_OVERWRITE)
5024  {
5025  pThis->iCursorY = iY + iDesc + 1;
5026  pThis->iCursorHeight = 1;
5027 
5028  rctCursor.left = pThis->iCursorX - iXDelta;
5029  rctCursor.top = pThis->iCursorY - iYDelta;
5030  rctCursor.right = pThis->iCursorX + iFontWidth - iXDelta;
5031  rctCursor.bottom = pThis->iCursorY - iYDelta;
5032  }
5033  else // INSERT mode cursor
5034  {
5035  pThis->iCursorY = iY - iAsc - 1;
5036  pThis->iCursorHeight = iY + iDesc + 1 - pThis->iCursorY;
5037 
5038  rctCursor.left = pThis->iCursorX - iXDelta;
5039  rctCursor.top = pThis->iCursorY - iYDelta;
5040  rctCursor.right = pThis->iCursorX - iXDelta;
5041  rctCursor.bottom = pThis->iCursorY + pThis->iCursorHeight - iYDelta;
5042  }
5043 
5044 
5045  if(pThis->iBlinkState != 0) // horizontal cursor for overwrite
5046  {
5047  if(WBRectOverlapped(rctCursor, pThis->rctHighLight))
5048  {
5049  XSetForeground(pDisplay, gc2 != None ? gc2 : gc, clrHFG);
5050  XSetBackground(pDisplay, gc2 != None ? gc2 : gc, clrHBG);
5051  }
5052  else
5053  {
5054  XSetForeground(pDisplay, gc2 != None ? gc2 : gc, clrFG);
5055  XSetBackground(pDisplay, gc2 != None ? gc2 : gc, clrBG);
5056  }
5057 
5058  XDrawLine(pDisplay, pxTemp != None ? pxTemp : wID,
5059  gc2 != None ? gc2 : gc,
5060  rctCursor.left, rctCursor.top, rctCursor.right, rctCursor.bottom);
5061  }
5062  }
5063

5067  rctChar.right = iX + iFontWidth - 1; // since I'm checking overlap, make it a bit 'skinnier'

5072  XSetBackground(pDisplay, gc2 != None ? gc2 : gc, clrHBG);
5073  }

5075  {

5077  XSetBackground(pDisplay, gc2 != None ? gc2 : gc, clrBG);
5078  }

5081  // the invalid region first...

5084  geomC.y = iY; // TODO: for single line, move this and the next 2 outside the loop?

5086  geomC.height = iFontHeight;

5106  }
5107  }
5108  }

5112  }
5113  }
5114  }

5116  {

5118 
5120  // MULTI LINE PAINTING
5122 
5123  // 3 different important conditions that affect painting:
5124  // 1. the cursor is (or is not) on this row
5125  // 2. the row has highlighting in it
5126  // 3. if 2, the row is either fully or partially highlighted
5127 
5128  // if 1 and 2 are FALSE, paint the string 'as-is' with DTDrawString
5129  // if 2 is TRUE, but 3 is false, paint the entire line "highlighted".
5130  // otherwise, duplicate (for this row) what single-line painting does,
5131  // dealing with cursor and highlight rectangles as needed, 1 char at a time
5132

5134

5136  {
5137  int bHighlight = 0;
5138 
5139  // NOTE: geomV already has 'border spacing' taken into account
5140

5142  + iAsc; // add the ascent to the top of the text to get "the baseline" for the font
5143

5158  }

5173  }
5174

5178  iCurRow == pThis->rctSel.bottom))) // it's the ending row for highlight

5196  ((iCurRow > pThis->rctSel.top &&
5197  iCurRow < pThis->rctSel.bottom) ||
5198  (iCurRow == pThis->rctSel.top &&
5199  i1 >= pThis->rctSel.left &&

5201  (iCurRow == pThis->rctSel.bottom && i1 < pThis->rctSel.right)))
5202  {

5204 
5205  // fill the rectangle for this character with the correct background color.
5206 
5207  if(pxTemp != None)
5208  {
5209  XSetForeground(pDisplay, gc2, clrHBG); // highlight background color
5210  XSetBackground(pDisplay, gc2, clrHBG);

5213  iX - iXDelta, iY0 - iYDelta,

5215

5217  }

5221  XSetBackground(pDisplay, gc, clrHBG);
5222 
5223  XFillRectangle(pDisplay, wID, gc,
5224  iX, iY0,
5225  iFontWidth, iFontHeight);
5226

5228  }
5229  }
5230  else // non-highlighted character
5231  {
5232  XSetForeground(pDisplay, gc2 != None ? gc2 : gc, clrFG);
5233  XSetBackground(pDisplay, gc2 != None ? gc2 : gc, clrBG);

5300 // }

5350  iX - iXDelta, iY - iYDelta,

5353 // else (this happens when lines are blank)
5354 // {

5356 // __FUNCTION__, pL, p1, p2, (int)(p2 - p1));
5357 // }

5364  //------------------------------------------
5365

5369  {

5371

5373  iY = pThis->rctWinView.top - MIN_BORDER_SPACING;

5376

5380  iW0 -= iX0;
5381  iX = geomP.x;
5382  }
5383

5385  {
5386  iW0 = geomP.x + geomP.width - iX;
5387  }
5388

5390  {
5391  iY0 = geomP.y - iY;
5392  iH0 -= iY0;
5393  iY = geomP.y;
5394  }
5395 
5396  if(geomP.y + geomP.height < iY + iH0)
5397  {
5398  iH0 = geomP.y + geomP.height - iY;
5399  }
5400 
5401  if(iH0 > 0 && iW0 > 0)
5402  {
5403  XCopyArea(pDisplay, pxTemp, wID, gc, // this time use GC to do the copy
5404  iX0, iY0, iW0, iH0, iX, iY);
5405  }
5406

5408  }
5409  }

5412 
5413  // mandatory resource free-up goes here, hence the 'goto' label
5414 
5415  if(gc2 != None)
5416  {
5417  XFreeGC(pDisplay, gc2);
5418  }
5419 
5420  if(rFontSet == None) // that is, I created one
5421  {
5422  XFreeFontSet(pDisplay, fSet);
5423  }
5424 }

5426 static void __internal_cursor_blink(struct _text_object_ *pThis, int bHasFocus)
5427 {
5428  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
5429  {
5430 // WB_RECT rctCursor;
5431 
5432  if(!bHasFocus)
5433  {
5434  if(pThis->iBlinkState)
5435  {
5436  pThis->iBlinkState = 0; // no cursor
5437 
5438  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 1);
5439  }
5440  }
5441  else
5442  {
5443  pThis->iBlinkState = (pThis->iBlinkState + 1) % 3;
5444 
5445  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, pThis->iBlinkState == 0 || pThis->iBlinkState == 1);
5446  }
5447  }
5448 }

5451 // ----------------------------
5452 // MBCS UTF-8 UTILITY FUNCTIONS
5453 // ----------------------------
5454 
5455 // see RFC3629 and https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF-8#Codepage_layout
5456 
5457 static int internal_IsMBCharValid(const char *pChar, int *piLen)
5458 {
5459 const unsigned char *p1;
5460 int iRval;
5461 
5462 
5463  if((unsigned char)*pChar < 0x80) // normal ASCII (including '0' byte)
5464  {
5465  if(piLen)
5466  {
5467  if(*pChar)
5468  {
5469  *piLen = 1;
5470  }
5471  else
5472  {
5473  *piLen = 0;
5474  }
5475  }
5476 
5477  return 1; // valid char
5478  }
5479 
5480  p1 = (const unsigned char *)pChar;
5481  iRval = 0; // initially, call it 'invalid'
5482 
5483  // 80-BF - values 0-3F 'continuation' bytes for mbcs [sequence will not start with this]
5484  // C0-DF - 2-byte character
5485  // (C0=0, C1=40H, C2=80H, up to 7C0H for DF; values C0 and C1 are actually 'not valid' as it's pointless)
5486  // E0-EF - 3-byte character
5487  // (E0 adds 800H; E1 adds 1000H; E2 2000H; etc. up to F000H for EF. not all E0 sequences are valid)
5488  // F0-FF - 4+byte character
5489  // (F0 is 10000H; F1 40000H; F2 80000H; F3 C0000H; F4 100000H; values F5 and above are 'not valid'
5490  // Not all F0's are valid, either)
5491  //
5492  // For invalid sequences, this function will attempt to work around it; however RFC3629 requires them to be error conditions
5493  // to avoid security-related problems caused by invalid UTF8 sequences.
5494 
5495  if(*p1 < 0xc2 || // a continuation character? an 'invalid' sequence?
5496  *p1 >= 0xf5) // assume value cannot be > 0xff, right?
5497  {
5498  p1++; // invalid; length is 1 (like ASCII)
5499  }
5500  else if(*p1 < 0xe0) // 2-byte sequence
5501  {
5502  if((unsigned char)p1[1] >= 0x80 && (unsigned char)p1[1] <= 0xbf) // valid 2-byte sequence
5503  {
5504  p1 += 2;
5505  iRval = 1;
5506  }
5507  else
5508  {
5509  p1++; // invalid; length is 1 (like ASCII)
5510  }
5511  }
5512  else if(*p1 < 0xf0) // 3-byte sequence
5513  {
5514  if(p1[1] >= 0x80 && p1[1] <= 0xbf && // valid 3-byte sequence
5515  p1[2] >= 0x80 && p1[2] <= 0xbf)
5516  {
5517  // TODO: validate E0 sequences
5518 
5519  p1 += 3;
5520  iRval = 1;
5521  }
5522  else // now it gets trickier...
5523  {
5524  // by convention, treat it like 8-bit ASCII with a length of 1
5525  p1++;
5526  }
5527  }
5528  else // if(*p1 < 0xf5)
5529  {
5530  if(p1[1] >= 0x80 && p1[1] <= 0xbf && // valid 4-byte sequence
5531  p1[2] >= 0x80 && p1[2] <= 0xbf &&
5532  p1[3] >= 0x80 && p1[3] <= 0xbf)
5533  {
5534  // TODO: validate F0 sequences
5535 
5536  p1 += 4;
5537  iRval = 1;
5538  }
5539  else // now it gets trickier...
5540  {
5541  // by convention, treat it like 8-bit ASCII with a length of 1
5542  p1++;
5543  }
5544  }
5545 
5546  if(piLen)
5547  {
5548  *piLen = (const char *)p1 - pChar; // this simplified length indicator helps with copy/pasta [if I need it]
5549  }
5550 
5551 #ifndef NO_DEBUG
5552  if(!iRval || ((const char *)p1 - pChar) > 1)
5553  {
5554  int iLen = ((const char *)p1 - pChar);
5555 
5556  WBDebugPrint("TEMPORARY: %s - return=%d char=%02xH", __FUNCTION__, iRval, (unsigned char)*pChar);
5557  while(iLen > 1)
5558  {
5559  iLen--;
5560  pChar++;
5561 
5562  WBDebugPrint(",%02xH", (unsigned char)*pChar);
5563  }
5564  WBDebugPrint("\n");
5565  }
5566 #endif // NO_DEBUG
5567 
5568  return iRval;
5569 }
5570 
5571 static int internal_MBstrlen(const char *pString)
5572 {
5573 const char *p1 = pString;
5574 int iLen, iRval;
5575 
5576 
5577  iRval = 0;
5578 
5579  while(*p1)
5580  {
5581  // step through 1 character at a time until I reach the end of the string, or iCol reaches zero
5582 
5583  if(!internal_IsMBCharValid(p1, &iLen))
5584  {
5585  p1++; // treat like 8-bit ASCII if it's an invalid UTF-8 sequence
5586 
5587  // NOTE: may change or render as EF BF BD i.e. U+FFFD (a diamond with question mark)
5588  }
5589  else
5590  {
5591  p1 += iLen;
5592  }
5593 
5594  iRval++; // we only count blue cars (and multi-byte chars as "1")
5595  }
5596 
5597  return iRval;
5598 }
5599 
5600 // return the 'character' index for the 'column' specified by 'iCol' for MBCS
5601 
5602 static int internal_MBColIndex(const char *pString, int iCol)
5603 {
5604 const char *p1 = pString;
5605 int iLen;
5606 
5607 
5608  while(iCol > 0 && *p1)
5609  {
5610  // step through 1 character at a time until I reach the end of the string, or iCol reaches zero
5611 
5612  if(!internal_IsMBCharValid(p1, &iLen))
5613  {
5614  p1++; // treat like 8-bit ASCII if it's an invalid UTF-8 sequence
5615 
5616  // NOTE: may change or render as EF BF BD i.e. U+FFFD (a diamond with question mark)
5617  }
5618  else
5619  {
5620  p1 += iLen;
5621  }
5622 
5623  iCol--;
5624  }
5625 
5626  return (p1 - pString); // NOTE: need to verify length before calling or this could be WRONG
5627 }

5650 char * WBSplitMBLine(char *pString, int iCol)
5651 {
5652 char *p1, *pRval;
5653 int iLen, i1;
5654 
5655 
5656  iLen = internal_MBstrlen(pString);
5657 
5658  if(iCol >= iLen) // past end of string?
5659  {
5660  pRval = WBCopyString(""); // allocated pointer that's a copy of an empty string - it's what I'll start with
5661  }
5662  else
5663  {
5664  i1 = internal_MBColIndex(pString, iCol);
5665 
5666  pRval = WBCopyString(pString + i1);
5667 
5668  if(pRval)
5669  {
5670  pString[i1] = 0; // terminate it here (my 'split')
5671  }
5672  }
5673 
5674  if(pRval) // if I have a valid return, right-trim the original line
5675  {
5676  p1 = pString + strlen(pString);
5677 
5678  while(p1 > pString && *(p1 - 1) <= ' ') // right-trim it
5679  {
5680  *(--p1) = 0; // right-trim the string - make ALL white space GO AWAY
5681  }
5682  }
5683 
5684  return(pRval);
5685 }

5687 char * WBJoinMBLine(char *pString, int iCol, const char *pJoin)
5688 {
5689 int iLen, iLenNew, iJoin;
5690 char *pRval, *p1;
5691 
5692 
5693  iLen = internal_MBstrlen(pString);
5694  if(iLen < iCol)
5695  {
5696  iLenNew = iCol;
5697  }
5698  else
5699  {
5700  iLenNew = iLen;
5701  }
5702 
5703  iJoin = internal_MBstrlen(pJoin);
5704 
5705  pRval = WBReAlloc(pString, iLenNew + iJoin + 2);
5706  if(!pRval)
5707  {
5708  return NULL;
5709  }
5710 
5711  p1 = pRval + strlen(pRval); // regardless of actual length, this works
5712 
5713  while(iLen < iLenNew)
5714  {
5715  *(p1++) = ' '; // add white space up to 'iCol'
5716  iLen++;
5717  }
5718 
5719  strcpy(p1, pJoin);
5720 
5721  return pRval;
5722 }
5723 
5724 int WBDelMBChars(char *pString, int iCol, int nDel, int *piNewCol, char **ppDeleted)
5725 {
5726 int iLen, iIndex, i1, iRval = nDel;
5727 char *pDelChar, *p1;
5728 
5729 
5730  if(ppDeleted)
5731  {
5732  *ppDeleted = NULL; // initial value
5733  }
5734 
5735  if(piNewCol)
5736  {
5737  *piNewCol = iCol; // initial value
5738  }
5739 
5740  if(!pString || !nDel || !*pString)
5741  {
5742  if(piNewCol)
5743  {
5744  *piNewCol = iCol; // for now, just do this, even if string is blank
5745  }
5746 
5747  return nDel; // parameter validation
5748  }
5749 
5750  iLen = internal_MBstrlen(pString);
5751 
5752  if(iRval > 0)
5753  {
5754  if(ppDeleted && iLen > iCol)
5755  {
5756  pDelChar = WBAlloc(4 // max size of MB char
5757  * (iLen - iCol + 1) // 1 more than # of chars to delete
5758  + 1); // additional storage for zero byte
5759 
5760  *ppDeleted = pDelChar; // NOTE: caller checks for NULL to determine error state
5761 
5762  if(pDelChar)
5763  {
5764  *pDelChar = 0; // make sure
5765  }
5766  }
5767  else
5768  {
5769  pDelChar = NULL;
5770  }
5771 
5772  while(iLen > iCol && iRval > 0)
5773  {
5774  iIndex = internal_MBColIndex(pString, iCol);
5775 
5776  p1 = pString + iIndex; // always
5777 
5778  if(!*p1)
5779  {
5780  break; // I'm at the end of the string (sanity test)
5781  }
5782 
5783  if(!internal_IsMBCharValid(p1, &i1))
5784  {
5785  // invalid character - truncate the line here!
5786 
5787  *p1 = 0;
5788  iRval = 0; // assume 'end of line' and terminate deleting
5789 
5790  break;
5791  }
5792 
5793  if(pDelChar && i1 > 0)
5794  {
5795  memcpy(pDelChar, p1, i1);
5796  pDelChar += i1;
5797 
5798  *pDelChar = 0; // mark the end of the string
5799  }
5800 
5801  iRval --; // deleting one character (so remove a 'delete')
5802  iLen--; // update the new length
5803 
5804  // i1 is the length of the next character. slide 'em down! [this is less efficient, but more 'stable']
5805  strcpy(p1, p1 + i1); // simplest method
5806  }
5807  }
5808  else
5809  {
5810  if(ppDeleted && iCol > 0)
5811  {
5812  pDelChar = WBAlloc(4 // max size of MB char
5813  * (iCol + 1) // 1 more than # of chars to delete
5814  + 1); // additional storage for zero byte
5815 
5816  *ppDeleted = pDelChar; // NOTE: caller checks for NULL to determine error state
5817 
5818  if(pDelChar)
5819  {
5820  *pDelChar = 0; // make sure
5821  }
5822  }
5823  else
5824  {
5825  pDelChar = NULL;
5826  }
5827 
5828  // NOW we do backspacing, which preserves the character at 'iCol'. this is a little trickier.
5829  // when we end up at column zero, we return the 'iRval' count.
5830 
5831  while(iCol > 0 && iRval < 0)
5832  {
5833  if(iCol <= iLen) // I'm NOT past the end
5834  {
5835  iIndex = internal_MBColIndex(pString, iCol - 1); // PREVIOUS column
5836 
5837  p1 = pString + iIndex; // always
5838 
5839  if(!*p1)
5840  {
5841  break; // I'm at the end of the string (sanity test, unlikely to happen)
5842  }
5843 
5844  if(!internal_IsMBCharValid(p1, &i1))
5845  {
5846  // invalid character - truncate the line here!
5847 
5848  *p1 = 0;
5849  iRval = 0; // assume 'end of line' at this point, and terminate deleting
5850 
5851  break;
5852  }
5853 
5854  if(pDelChar && i1 > 0)
5855  {
5856  // insert this character into the beginning of the 'undo' info string
5857  // there are probably BETTER ways to do this, but this is what I'll do.
5858 
5859  memmove(pDelChar + i1, pDelChar, strlen(pDelChar) + 1); // open up space. make sure ending zero byte is included.
5860  memcpy(pDelChar, p1, i1);
5861  }
5862 
5863  // i1 is the length of the prev character, so slide 'em down! [this is less efficient, but more 'stable']
5864  strcpy(p1, p1 + i1); // simplest method (I could also get the pointer to the 'iCol'th char, but this is more consistent)
5865  }
5866  else
5867  {
5868  // since I'm at the end, just delete the last char in the line (effectively) by decrementing the column
5869  // so nothing else to do here other than the end of the loop
5870  }
5871 
5872  iCol--;
5873  iRval++; // because it's NEGATIVE, so we increment it
5874  }
5875  }
5876 
5877  // it seems in both cases (above) this section remains exactly the same
5878  // how amazing that works out!
5879 
5880  if(piNewCol)
5881  {
5882  *piNewCol = iCol; // 'iCol' will be the NEW column for the cursor
5883  }
5884 
5885  return iRval;
5886 }
5887 
5888 int WBGetMBLength(const char *pString)
5889 {
5890  if(!pString)
5891  {
5892  return 0;
5893  }
5894 
5895  return internal_MBstrlen(pString);
5896 }
5897 
5898 char * WBGetMBCharPtr(char *pString, int iCol, int *pcbLen)
5899 {
5900 int iIndex;
5901 
5902 
5903  if(!pString)
5904  {
5905  return NULL;
5906  }
5907 
5908  iIndex = internal_MBColIndex(pString, iCol);
5909 
5910  if(pString[iIndex]) // it's not a 0-byte
5911  {
5912  if(!internal_IsMBCharValid(pString + iIndex, pcbLen))
5913  {
5914  return NULL; // character is not valid
5915  }
5916  }
5917  else
5918  {
5919  if(pcbLen)
5920  {
5921  *pcbLen = 0;
5922  }
5923 
5924  // TODO: anything else?
5925  }
5926 
5927  return pString + iIndex;
5928 }
5929 
5930 int WBGetMBColIndex(const char *pString, const char *pChar)
5931 {
5932 const char *p1 = pString;
5933 int iLen, iRval;
5934 
5935 
5936  if(pChar <= pString)
5937  {
5938  return 0;
5939  }
5940 
5941  iRval = 0;
5942 
5943  while(*p1 && p1 < pChar)
5944  {
5945  // step through 1 character at a time until I reach the end of the string, or iCol reaches zero
5946 
5947  if(!internal_IsMBCharValid(p1, &iLen))
5948  {
5949  p1++; // treat like 8-bit ASCII if it's an invalid UTF-8 sequence
5950 
5951  // NOTE: may change or render as EF BF BD i.e. U+FFFD (a diamond with question mark)
5952  }
5953  else
5954  {
5955  p1 += iLen;
5956  }
5957 
5958  iRval++; // we only count blue cars (and multi-byte chars as "1")
5959  }
5960 
5961  if(p1 != pChar)
5962  {
5963  return 0; // this is an error condition
5964  }
5965 
5966  return iRval; // returns the actual column index for 'pChar' within the string pointed by 'pString'
5967 }
